title: Automation & AI Systems Lead (GHL + Make/n8n + Voice AI)
description:
Company Overview



We are an AI-native agency + software platform for home service businesses (HVAC and plumbing). We automate lead intake, follow-ups, booking,  ads, reviews, and customer support using GoHighLevel, Voice AI, and workflow automation tools.



We are starting by building on top of GHL but we may migrate to a stand-alone platform and automations as needed.



Our mission is simple:

Replace traditional agency labor with scalable automation + AI systems.



Role Summary



We are hiring an Automation + AI Systems Lead to own, build and maintain our automation infrastructure.



This role will manage and improve systems involving:



GoHighLevel workflows




 or n8n automation logic



Voice AI agents (Vapi currently, but potentially or Retell)



CRM integrations with GHL and Voice AI (ServiceTitan, Housecall Pro, Jobber, Service Fusion etc)



This is NOT a VA role. This is a systems-builder role that requires building and maintaining



Technical background and knowledge of AI tools (claude code, cursor etc) preferred. 



We are looking for an AI native builder who can help us build systems that scale. You must actively use tools like Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor, or Claude Code daily to build faster.



Core Responsibilities

Advanced GHL knowledge (including latest AI tools)



Automation & Workflow Systems



Build and maintain automation flows in 
 and/or n8n



Understanding of APIs



Design robust workflows with error handling, retries, and logging



Create scalable automations that can be reused for multiple clients



GoHighLevel Implementation



Build pipelines, triggers, workflows, tags, campaigns, calendars



Implement lead nurture sequences (SMS/email)



Maintain clean structure inside client sub-accounts



Voice AI Systems  



Deploy and maintain AI voice agents (Vapi or Retell)



Integrate voice agents with GHL and CRM booking flows



Handle call routing, appointment booking, reschedules, cancellations



Ensure transcripts + call data are stored properly



Use AI tools for voice ai simulations and observability



Integrations



Connect GHL to ServiceTitan, Housecall Pro, Jobber, and Service Fusion



Build systems using webhooks + APIs



Support hybrid approach: Make/n8n + direct API when needed



Documentation + QA



Document workflows clearly



Create testing checklists for call flows



Run QA and debugging until automations are stable



Must-Have Skills



Strong experience with GoHighLevel workflows + pipelines



Strong experience with 
 OR n8n



Comfortable with APIs, webhooks, JSON payloads



Able to troubleshoot inconsistent data formatting issues



Organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple systems



Bonus Skills (Highly Preferred)



Experience with Vapi or Retell AI



Experience with Supabase or Postgres databases



Experience building AI agents or RAG knowledge bases



Ability to write high-quality automation copy (SMS/email scripts)



Tools We Use



GoHighLevel (GHL)




 / n8n



Vapi or Retell AI



Whatsapp



Google Sheets / Docs



Zapier (sometimes)



Supabase



Github



Compensation



$1000 – $1,600/month full-time (40 hours a week) depending on skill level. Exceptional candidates may be offered higher compensation.



(We are open to 20 hours a week  if you are experienced and can work independently.)



Schedule



Full-time preferred (40 hours/week)



Must overlap at least 2–4 hours/day with US time zones



Trial / Test Period



We start with a 2–4 week paid trial.

If successful, you will become a long-term key tea
mber.



How to Apply



Please Send:



A short intro + your strongest skills



Your desired salary and when you are available to start



State your experience with GHL + Automation + Development (in months/years)



Links/screenshots of workflows you built in GHL / Make / n8n



A brief example of an automation you built end-to-end



Which voice AI tools you’ve used (if any)



1-2 sentences about what you think is the biggest opportunity to automate small business workflows with AI

title: Credit Repair Dispute Agent (VA)
description:
Position Overview:

CreditHoods is seeking an experienced Credit Repair Dispute Agent to join our team. This role involves preparing, reviewing, and submitting dispute letters across national public records, rental history, credit bureaus, and data providers. You will work closely with our internal team to ensure accuracy, timely follow-up, and strong client results.

This is a high-trust position requiring confidentiality, professionalism, and strong attention to detail. Performance bonuses will be provided.



Key Responsibilities:



Prepare and submit dispute letters according to CreditHoods' SOPs and consumer law guidelines.

Review credit reports, public record data, rental history, and supporting documents.

Track client progress and update all case information in Google Drive / Google Docs.

Assist management with escalations and ensure disputes are completed on time.

Maintain consistent communication with internal tea
mbers.

Uphold strict confidentiality with all client data and company processes.



Required Qualifications:



Fluent in English (verbal + written).

Experience in credit repair (disputing, bureaus, public records, consumer laws, or similar).

Proficient with Google Docs and Google Drive.

Strong organizational and documentation skills.

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Must maintain strict confidentiality at all times.

Required Work Time Frames: 2am-9am or 10am-5pm Eastern Time



Compensation & Bonuses:

Competitive pay based on experience

Performance bonuses available

Opportunities for advancement as the company scales



Preferred Traits

Detail-oriented and accurate

Fast learner with a strong work ethic

Excellent written communication

Knowledge in consumer disputing

CFPB Knowledge

Familiarity with data providers like LexisNexis, CIC, Accurint (optional but preferred)



Confidentiality Notice

All client information, documents, and internal systems you access are strictly confidential. Any unauthorized disclosure will result in immediate termination.

title: Video Ad Editor [We Will Train You So You Can Be a Profitable Video Editor]
description:
We're a company who owns several brands, mostly pets and kitchen stuff (not an agency) - we currently have 5 video editors and we need 1 more!



What are we looking for?



We're looking for someone who wants to learn how to be a video editor that knows how to make videos that CONVERT - maybe you know how to make videos that look cute, great. The problem is that cute videos don't make you a lot of money. We will teach you how to make videos that convert because we're a company that is high volume sales.



What we are offering?



- $1000/month for 3 months.

- $1300 after 3 months.

- Monday to Friday - 8 hours per day. Have full weekends off - after 3 months, the schedule is very flexible and you can move hours around.

- Potential for commission after you've proven yourself (6-7 months)



Who are we looking for?



- It's ok if you have NO EXPERIENCE in video editing etc.

- Someone who is motivated - the initial 2-3 months, there's 8 hours of actual work that we'll give you (most of it training) but if you want to be successful then you need to watch content about your industry (like literally watch cat/cooking videos) for 2-3 hours a day and then another 2 hours of self-education (reading books about copywriting, watching training videos, etc) - WHY? Because if you're REALLY REALLY good at video editing, after 6-8 months, we can promote you into making commission for the videos you make. With commission, you can make 2x your salary if your video does well.

- We have excellent resources of books/podcasts/videos/etc for your after work hours! We can't force you to read them but they are what makes a huge difference between someone making $1-2k/month and someone making $5k/month

title: HIGH-TICKET SALES PRO – TECH / SAAS (BASE + COMMISSION)
description:

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Staff Connect Australia

Location: Remote (Australia market focus)

Reports to: Director

Work Hours: Monday – Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM AEDT



About the Role



Staff Connect Australia is seeking a strategic and research-driven Business Development Manager to expand our presence within the roadside and auto service sectors.



This is not a traditional “hard sales” role.



The BDM is responsible for building a high-quality prospect pipeline, initiating meaningful conversations with qualified operators, and securing discovery meetings for the Director. You will not be responsible for closing deals or negotiating pricing — your focus is creating strong, qualified opportunities.



We are looking for someone who understands that quality beats quantity and who enjoys structured outbound strategy rather than transactional selling.



Key Responsibilities



1. Building the Prospect Engine

- Research and identify qualified roadside and auto service operators across Australia

- Build and maintain a structured, accurate CRM database

- Categorise and segment leads correctly

- Ensure all prospect records are complete and usable





2. Ideal Client Targeting

Focus on:

- Roadside assistance providers

- Auto service networks with dispatch or call centre operations

- Multi-state or national operators

- 24/7 or extended-hours service businesses



Avoid:

- Single-truck operators

- Small workshops

- Businesses that are purely price-driven





3. Outbound Outreach

- Execute structured
, LinkedIn, and phone outreach

- Open conversations around operational challenges — not pricing

- Identify pain points related to dispatch, support, and scaling

- Secure high-quality discovery calls





4. Qualification & Handover



Before booking a discovery meeting, you will:



- Identify the decision maker

- Understand business size and structure

- Surface operational pressure points

- Gauge interest level



 You will prepare a clear, structured briefing before handing the opportunity to the Director.



Tools & Systems You’ll Use

You will work daily with:

- Aircall – outbound and inbound calls

- LinkedIn – prospect research, outreach, and relationship building

- Google Workspace, including:

- Google Sheets (lead database & tracking)

- Google Docs (scripts, strategy, documentation)

- Google Calendar (meeting scheduling)

- Gmail (prospect communication)

- Slack – internal team communication

- Canva – light document or presentation support where needed



Comfort using these tools (or similar systems) is important. Process discipline and CRM hygiene are essential in this role.



How We Position Ourselves



We are not selling offshore staff or cheap labour.



We position ourselves as an operational growth partner helping roadside and auto service operators build structured, scalable dispatch and support operations — so growth doesn’t create chaos.



What Success Looks Like

A successful BDM in this role:

- Builds a clean, qualified database

- Books discovery meetings with strong strategic fit

- Prioritises quality over volume

- Maintains disciplined CRM hygiene

- Takes ownership of the outbound process



This is a long-cycle B2B sales environment. Patience, consistency, and structured thinking matter.



Compensation

This role includes:

- Competitive fixed base salary

- Performance-based commission structure



In addition to your fixed pay, you will receive commission for qualified opportunities that convert into clients. The commission model is designed to reward quality over volume and is aligned with long-term client value.



High performers will have strong earning potential through consistent pipeline contribution and successful client acquisitions.



Full commission structure details will be discussed during the interview process.



Ideal Candidate Profile

We are looking for someone who:

- Has 2–5 years of BDM, SDR, or outbound experience (B2B preferred)

- Is strong at research (Google, LinkedIn, CRM tools)

- Communicates clearly and professionally

- Is confident asking qualification questions

- Thrives in structured processes

- Takes ownership without micromanagement





Bonus if you:

- Understand dispatch-heavy or service-based businesses

- Have experience in SaaS or operational consulting sales

- Are comfortable working within long buying cycles

title: Part-Time Appointment Setter – US Financial Services (Phone)
description:
About the Role

We're looking for a professional, articulate phone appointment setter to follow up with US-based webinar attendees and book appointments for financial advisors.

This is a part-time role (15-20 hours/week) with the potential to grow into full-time as we scale. You'll be calling people who have already attended a webinar about retirement planning — these are warm leads, not cold calls.

Your job is simple: call attendees, confirm their interest, and schedule a one-on-one appointment with the advisor. You are NOT selling any products or giving financial advice.



Responsibilities



Call US-based webinar attendees using a provided dialer/phone system

Follow a proven call script to book appointments for financial advisors

Handle basic objections professionally (timing, interest level, scheduling)

Log all call outcomes and appointment details in our CRM (GoHighLevel)

Send confirmation texts/emails to booked appointments

Provide daily call reports (calls made, contacts reached, appointments booked)

Coordinate with multiple advisor accounts as we scale





Requirements

Must-Have:



Clear, neutral English accent (you will be speaking with American retirees and pre-retirees)

Previous experience in outbound calling, appointment setting, or telemarketing

Comfortable making 40-60+ calls per shift

Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

Headset with noise cancellation

Available to work US business hours (flexible on timezone overlap — we need at least 3-4 hours during US daytime: 9 AM – 6 PM Central Time)

Positive, professional phone presence



Nice-to-Have:



Experience in financial services, insurance, or B2C appointment setting

BPO / call center background

Familiarity with GoHighLevel, HubSpot, or similar CRM

Experience working with US-based clients





Work Schedule



Part-time: 15-20 hours per week

Work is concentrated around webinar dates (typically 1-2 webinars per month per advisor)

Heaviest call volume is the 3-5 days following each webinar

Must be available during US Central Time business hours





Compensation



Starting rate: $5-7/hour USD (based on experience)

Potential to $10+/hour

Potential to grow to full-time with a raise as we add more advisor accounts

Paid via direct bank transfer or Wise





What Success Looks Like



40-60 calls per shift

15-25% contact rate

Booking 3-5 appointments per calling session

Professional, warm demeanor on every call

Accurate logging of all activity in CRM





How to Apply

Please include the following in your application:



A brief introduction about yourself and your calling experience

A 60-second voice recording of you reading the script below (upload to Google Drive or send as an attachment):





"Hi, is this [name]? Great! My name is [your name], and I'm calling from [advisor's practice name]. I noticed you attended our recent retirement planning webinar, and I wanted to personally reach out. Many of our attendees found it helpful to schedule a quick 15-minute one-on-one session with [advisor name] to review their specific situation. Would you be open to setting up a brief call this week?"





Your available hours during US Central Time (9 AM – 6 PM CT)

Your expected hourly rate



We're looking to hire quickly and start with a paid 1-week trial.



This is a long-term position with a growing US-based SaaS company serving financial advisors. If you're reliable, professional, and great on the phone, there's significant room to grow with us.

title: Remote Joinery Estimator (EN Standards)
description:
Connaught Joinery – Ireland

Full-Time | Remote (Philippines) | Long-Term Position



Connaught Joinery is an Irish manufacturing company specialising in premium prehung doorsets, fire doors, and bespoke joinery.

We are seeking an experienced Joinery Estimator to prepare detailed tenders, quotations, and schedules of works for our Irish and European projects - fully remotely from the Philippines.



-



Role Overview



You will be responsible for preparing accurate cost estimates and schedules for joinery and doorset projects.

This includes interpreting architectural drawings, door schedules, and ironmongery specifications, ensuring all outputs meet European (EN) standards for fire and acoustic performance.



You’ll work closely with our Irish estimating and production teams to deliver precise, compliant, and professional tenders.



-



Key Responsibilities

 • Review architectural drawings, door schedules, and specifications

 • Prepare tender quotations, BOQs, and Schedules of Works

 • Apply and understand EN fire door standards (FD30, FD60, etc.)

 • Compile ironmongery sets and confirm compliance with EN-rated hardware

 • Support pricing through templates or exports from Intact IQ ERP

 • Collaborate via Microsoft Teams and shared folders with our Irish team

 • Maintain consistency, accuracy, and attention to detail in all outputs



-



Required Skills & Experience

 • Minimum 3 years’ experience in joinery, fit-out, or doorset estimating

 • Strong knowledge of:

 • EN-standard fire doors and acoustic doorsets

 • Ironmongery schedules and hardware coordination

 • Prehung and bespoke joinery systems

 • Proficient in Excel, PDF markup, and AutoCAD or Bluebeam for take-offs

 • Excellent English communication and strong technical understanding

 • Highly organised, self-motivated, and able to meet tender deadlines



-



Preferred (Not Required)

 • Familiarity with Intact IQ ERP or similar systems

 • Experience with PlanSwift, Bluebeam, or take-off software

 • Prior exposure to Irish or European joinery standards



-



Compensation & Benefits

 • p46,000 – p70,000 per month (USD $800 – $1,200 equivalent)

 • Performance bonus based on project accuracy and turnaround

 • Long-term contract with career growth opportunities

 • Monday–Friday, 4 PM – 12 AM PH time (to align with Ireland)

 • Fully remote with video check-ins and digital workflow



-



About Connaught Joinery



Connaught Joinery is part of The Connaught Door Centre Group, based in Galway, Ireland.

We design and manufacture premium prehung door systems, EN fire doors, and bespoke joinery for residential and commercial projects nationwide.

Our operations are built on precision CNC manufacturing, ERP-driven workflows, and a culture of excellence.



-



How to Apply



Please submit:

 1. Your CV / résumé

 2. An example of a tender, take-off, or quotation you’ve produced

 3. A short note on your experience with EN-standard fire doors or joinery projects



Please send the above to :

This role is suited to someone who enjoys accuracy, structure and improving financial systems. It is not an entry level role. You will be trusted with clean records across multiple entities.



This role will start part time at 25 hours per week at $4 per hour as a trial period, with the intention to move to full time hours and a higher rate once the right long term candidate is proven.



Some overlap with UK working hours is required.

This role suits someone looking for a focused long term position rather than juggling multiple ongoing roles.



Key responsibilities



Bookkeeping and accounting

Full bookkeeping in QuickBooks Online

Accurate categorisation of all transactions

Bank and credit card reconciliations

Handling multiple entities and accounts

Understanding income splits between client income and management income

Monthly profit and loss preparation

Cashflow tracking and visibility

Preparing clean records for VAT returns and year end accounts

Working with Airbnb, 
 and direct booking payouts

Creating systems and improving bookkeeping workflows

Using ChatGPT to improve efficiency, accuracy and consistency where appropriate



Required skills and experience

Expert level working knowledge of QuickBooks Online

At least 1 year hands on bookkeeping or accounting experience

Strong understanding of bookkeeping fundamentals

High attention to detail and accuracy

Fluent English spoken and written

Excellent organisation and time management

Confident using ChatGPT as a daily work tool

Able to follow instructions exactly and consistently

Reliable internet connection and quiet working environment

Willing to learn the short term let industry if not already experienced



Nice to have

Not holding multiple full time roles or conflicting long term commitments, allowing full focus and high performance

Experience with Airbnb or short term lets

Understanding of VAT or multi entity businesses

Experience creating SOPs and improving workflows



What success looks like after 90 days

Books are fully up to date and accurate

title: TikTok Ads Media Buyer: Scale E-Commerce Brands to 6-7 Figures
description:
We need a media buyer who's already done this before.

If you:



Have scaled e-commerce brands past $100K/month on TikTok Ads

Know the difference between testing strategy and scaling strategy

Can read data and make decisions fast (not wait for permission)

Understand creative fatigue and how to refresh before performance dies

Don't need hand-holding to set up pixels, campaigns, or troubleshoot account issues



...keep reading.



What we're building:

We run a 6-figure/month e-commerce operation across Switzerland (FR/DE), Italy, and expanding to the US. Multiple D2C stores, 8+ active products, aggressive testing and scaling on TikTok Ads and Meta.

We need someone who owns the paid acquisition engine — testing, scaling, and keeping ROAS stable while we grow.



Your actual job:

Run TikTok Ads profitably at scale:

Campaign Management:



Launch 3-5 new product tests per day with SmartPlus campaigns

Manage budget allocation across markets (CH-FR, CH-DE, IT, US)

Scale winners aggressively without killing ROAS

Kill losers fast (no emotional attachment to products)

Monitor daily performance and adjust budgets in real-time



Creative Testing:



Test 3+ creatives per product minimum

Identify winning hooks, angles, and formats

Request new creatives from video editors when creative fatigue hits

Test trending TikTok sounds and formats (using TikTok Creative Center)

Add static images to scaling campaigns when applicable



Data & Optimization:



Track ROAS by product, market, and creative

Identify which products to scale vs kill based on data (not gut feeling)

Optimize ad spend to hit profit targets (we track net margin, not just ROAS)

Report daily: what's working, what's not, what needs changing

Use tools: TikTok Ads Manager, TrueProfit, Google Sheets for tracking



Technical Setup:



Set up pixels, Business Centers, and ad accounts independently

Troubleshoot tracking issues (pixel fires, attribution problems)

Handle DMCA or account flags without panic

Manage multiple ad accounts across different markets





What makes you the right person:

? You're NOT a beginner who "wants to learn TikTok Ads"

? You've already scaled brands to $50K-$100K/month+ on TikTok

? You're NOT someone who needs step-by-step instructions

? You know how to test, read data, and scale without micromanagement

? You're NOT just a "campaign launcher"

? You understand the entire funnel: creative ? campaign ? conversion ? profit

? You're NOT afraid of high ad spend

? You're comfortable managing $3K-$10K+ daily budgets



You should apply if:



Proven track record: You've scaled e-commerce brands on TikTok Ads (fashion, beauty, lifestyle, home goods — any category works)

Data-driven: You make decisions based on numbers, not feelings

Creative-minded: You understand what makes a TikTok ad work (hooks, trends, formats)

Fast executor: You test fast, kill fast, scale fast

Technical: Pixel setup, Business Center management, tracking troubleshooting — you've done it all

Independent: You don't wait for approval to make obvious optimizations

English fluent: Clear written and verbal communication (we're a global team)

Available 30-40 hours/week



Bonus points if you have:



Experience with European markets (Germany, Switzerland, Italy)

Experience scaling SmartPlus campaigns specifically

Knowledge of Meta Ads (we run both platforms)

Experience with multi-market campaigns (different languages, currencies)





What you get:



$8-$12/hour to start, negotiable based on results (we pay more as you scale profitably)

Performance bonuses: Hit ROAS targets consistently ? earn more

Clear growth path: Prove yourself ? become Head of Paid Acquisition

Direct access to founder: You'll shape strategy, not just execute

Budget to work with: We're ready to spend — you just need to make it profitable

Long-term role: We're building for 7 figures, not a quick project





This isn't for everyone.

If you want a "safe" job where you launch campaigns and wait for results — don't apply.

If you want to own paid acquisition for a fast-scaling brand and get rewarded for performance — keep reading.



How to apply:



First sentence MUST include "SCALE" or we delete your application

Share your best TikTok Ads case study (product, budget, ROAS, revenue — real numbers only)

Tell us which markets/countries you've worked in

List the e-commerce brands or niches you've scaled (fashion, beauty, home, etc.)

What's your testing strategy for new products? (Describe your process in 3-4 sentences)

Hours available per week + timezone



No generic applications. No made-up numbers. Show us proof.



Hiring process:



Top 10 candidates ? DISC test + typing test

10-minute intro call ? check: do you know your shit? can you communicate clearly?

Test task ? Launch a test campaign with provided creatives and report results

Follow-up call ? deeper strategy questions, ROAS targets, scaling approach

Hire within 3 days



Start date: ASAP

We're ready to spend. Are you ready to scale?

Submit your updated resume.

ABOUT US:

Amity Health Group is a fast-growing home health organization focused on excellence, compliance, and efficient operations. We rely heavily on accurate and consistent use of WellSky Home Health for our skilled services across multiple states.

We are seeking a WellSky Home Health Software Specialist who will oversee software usage, ensure system accuracy, and educate our team to maintain consistent and compliant workflows.



POSITION SUMMARY:

This per-diem role is responsible for mastering, navigating, and managing all aspects of the WellSky Home Health software and ensuring our team understands and correctly uses the system.

The specialist will train staff, audit workflows, guide system usage, and ensure our processes align with skilled home health guidelines, including services such as PT, OT, Nursing, Wound Care, and Speech Therapy.

Applicants must already be fully trained in WellSky and able to provide certification proof.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

System Navigation & Software Expertise

Navigate all modules of WellSky Home Health with expert proficiency.

Guide staff on documentation, visit entry, workflows, care planning, scheduling, and episode management.

Ensure correct use of the platform for skilled home health services.

Team Education & Training

Train new and existing staff on how to use WellSky effectively.

Create and lead training sessions, onboarding guides, and workflow instructions.

Provide ongoing support for clinicians, intake, scheduling, QA, and administrative teams.

Ensure every tea
mber understands system expectations and can confidently use the software.

Workflow & Compliance Oversight

Audit documentation workflows to ensure compliance with home health guidelines and agency standards.

Ensure workflows follow proper sequencing for skilled services (PT, OT, Nursing, Wound Care, SLP).

Identify documentation or workflow gaps and provide corrective guidance.

Assist with system updates, configuration checks, and process improvements.

Support & Problem Resolution

Provide troubleshooting support for software-related issues.

Serve as the internal “go-to expert” for all WellSky questions.

Collaborate with leadership to maintain consistent and compliant system usage.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Official WellSky Home Health training completion (certificates required).

Extensive experience using WellSky Home Health in a skilled home health environment.

Familiarity with home health operations, workflows, and clinical documentation outlines.

Strong teaching, training, and communication skills.

Ability to work independently and support a multi-state team remotely.

Highly organized, patient, and detail-oriented.



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Experience training or supporting home health teams in a similar role.

Background in skilled home health operations or QA.

Experience improving workflow efficiency through system guidance.



CORE EXPECTATIONS:

Software mastery

Strong educator and communicator

Patience and clarity in training

Attention to workflow compliance

Organizational excellence

Proactive problem-solving

Independence and accountability

title: Photo Editor & Graphic Designer (YouTube Thumbnails & Social Media)
description:
### ** Hiring: Photo Editor & Graphic Designer (YouTube Thumbnails & Social Media)**



Are you a **Photoshop wizard** with a talent for **photo editing, retouching, and eye-catching graphic design**? Do you know how to create **highly clickable YouTube thumbnails** and **engaging social media visuals**? If so, we’re looking for YOU!



---



### ** About the Role:**

We’re looking for a **skilled photo editor & graphic designer** who can fix, enhance, and Photoshop images while also **creating custom YouTube thumbnails, social media graphics, and promotional materials**. Your work will play a key role in **making content more engaging and clickable.**



---



### ** Responsibilities:**

**Photo Editing & Retouching:**

- Color correction, exposure fixes, and lighting adjustments

- Removing blemishes, unwanted objects, and refining details

- Background removal and photo manipulation



 **YouTube Thumbnail Design:**

- Create **highly engaging, bold, and clickable** thumbnails

- Use **eye-catching colors, text overlays, and composition techniques**

- Ensure thumbnails match **current YouTube trends** for better CTR (click-through rate)



 **Graphic Design for Social Media & Branding:**

- Create **IG, TikTok, and
** graphics

- Design banners, promotional materials, and brand assets

- Maintain brand consistency across all visuals



---



 ** Requirements:**

 **Expertise in Photoshop & Graphic Design Software** (Adobe Photoshop, Canva, Illustrator, or similar)

**Experience in Photo Editing, Retouching, & Color Correction**

 **Strong portfolio of YouTube thumbnails & social media graphics**

**Understanding of YouTube's best practices for thumbnails & engagement strategies**

 Ability to **work fast and meet deadlines**

Attention to detail and ability to bring creative ideas to life



---



### * Bonus Skills (Not Required, but Preferred):**

 Experience with **motion graphics & animations (After Effects or Premiere Pro)**

 Background in **branding & visual storytelling**

Knowledge of **AI tools for graphic design & photo editing**



---







 **How to Apply:**

1 Send your **resume & portfolio** showcasing your best:

- YouTube Thumbnails

- Social Media Graphics

- Photo Editing Before/After Examples

Include a brief note on your experience with photo editing & YouTube thumbnails

(Optional) Share an example of a **thumbnail redesign idea for one of our videos



**Apply now *



If you love **turning visuals into viral-worthy content**, we want to hear from you!

title: Content video editor
description:
We are looking for a creative, trend-savvy YouTube Video Editor to join our team. In this role, you’ll transform raw footage into engaging, high-impact videos that resonate with audiences and reflect the latest online trends. From snappy transitions to eye-catching motion graphics, your edits will shape our channel’s identity and drive viewer engagement. If you’re passionate about storytelling, social media culture, and the newest editing styles, we want to hear from you!



Please look at these accounts to get an idea what style of editing we are looking for:



















Key Responsibilities

Video Editing & Post-Production

Edit and assemble recorded footage into compelling, on-brand content for YouTube and other social media channels.

Incorporate trendy editing techniques, visual effects, and motion graphics to keep videos fresh and engaging.

Balance pacing, narrative flow, and comedic timing in line with current YouTube best practices.

Creative Direction

Stay ahead of editing trends, including transitions, text animations, color grading, and sound design.

Collaborate with the content team to develop creative storyboards or shot lists.

Brainstorm content ideas and suggest improvements to existing and upcoming videos.

Brand Consistency & Quality

Ensure visual consistency across all content (e.g., logos, fonts, color palettes, intro/outro).

Maintain high production standards, including aspect ratios, resolution, and audio clarity.

Perform final checks for continuity, color accuracy, and transition smoothness before publishing.

Collaboration & Project Management

Work closely with producers, videographers, and other stakeholders to meet deadlines and content goals.

Adapt to feedback and revisions promptly while maintaining overall project vision.

Use project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana, or 
) and communicate via Slack or similar platforms.

Optimization & Analysis

Leverage metadata, YouTube analytics, and audience feedback to refine editing approaches.

Experiment with new editing formats or effects to improve viewer engagement.

Contribute to post-mortem discussions to evaluate what worked well and identify areas for improvement.



On times there are no edits, research trends for future video ideas and have weekly or monthly meetings for these ideas.



Required Qualifications

Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Film Production, Media, Communications, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

1+ years of experience editing videos for YouTube or other social media platforms.

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve.

Basic knowledge of motion graphics (e.g., Adobe After Effects) is a plus.

Familiarity with color grading, sound mixing, and file management best practices.

Creative Skills:

Thorough understanding of current YouTube trends, viral editing styles, and internet culture.

Strong sense of pacing, storytelling, and visual design.

Ability to seamlessly blend video, audio, and graphical elements into a coherent narrative.

Soft Skills:

Excellent communication and teamwork skills; able to work independently and collaborate remotely.

Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time-management abilities.

Adaptable to fast-changing creative directions and feedback.



Preferred Qualifications

Experience creating thumbnail graphics, short-form social media clips, or TikTok/Reels-style edits.

Familiarity with basic animation and motion typography.

Knowledge of video SEO and YouTube algorithm best practices.

Experience using Slack or Trello (or similar platforms) for remote collaboration.





How to Apply:

Interested candidates should submit their resume AND portfolio link showcasing relevant video editing work. Please include references or links to any YouTube channels or specific videos you’ve edited to demonstrate your editing style.



Join us and help create content that captivates and inspires our digital audience—apply now!

title: YouTube Script Writer (Storytelling, Challenges, Pranks, Vlogs)
description:
Job Title: YouTube Script Writer (Storytelling, Challenges, Pranks, Vlogs)**

Location:** Remote

Job Type:** Part-Time or Full-Time



**About Us:**

We are a fast-paced digital media team producing high-energy YouTube videos across multiple family entertainment channels. Our content includes challenges, pranks, story-driven vlogs, dramatic mini-arcs, comedy, and trendy viral formats. We are looking for a creative script writer who understands YouTube culture and can develop compelling storylines that keep viewers watching.



**Job Description:**

We are seeking a YouTube Script Writer who can craft engaging scripts tailored to creator-style content. This role involves building storylines, adding humor, creating dramatic tension, and structuring scenes in a way that maximizes watch time and viewer retention. You’ll work closely with our creators to write scripts for challenges, pranks, vlogs, story episodes, and trend-based videos.



**Responsibilities:**



* Write clear, entertaining, and structured scripts for YouTube videos, including:



  * Challenges

  * Pranks

  * Vlogs

  * Drama-based episodes

  * Comedy and funny reaction segments

  * Trend-inspired content

* Develop story arcs that fit our creators’ personalities and brand.

* Pitch creative ideas for future videos based on YouTube trends, seasonal 
nts, and platform insights.

* Write scene breakdowns, intros, transitions, dialogue prompts, and ending hooks.

* Adjust writing tone depending on channel style and audience demographic.

* Stay updated on trending YouTube formats, viral topics, and competitive creators.

* Work with editors and producers to ensure scripts translate well on camera.



**Qualifications:**



* Proven experience writing scripts for YouTube or other digital platforms.

* Strong understanding of YouTube trends, storytelling formats, retention strategies, and thumbnail/title psychology.

* Ability to write fast, meet deadlines, and revise quickly based on feedback.

* Creative thinker with a sense of humor and strong storytelling instincts.

* Familiarity with family-friendly content and high-energy entertainment.



**Preferred Skills:**



* Experience writing for challenge or prank videos.

* Knowledge of YouTube analytics and retention curves.

* Ability to brainstorm large batches of ideas at a time.



**How to Apply:**

Please submit your resume, writing samples (ideally YouTube-style scripts), and a short paragraph explaining why you’re a great fit for this role.

title: Medical Virtual Assistant for Patient Scheduling & Coordination (US Acupuncture Clinic)
description:
I am a licensed acupuncturist and clinic owner based in the United States. I run a boutique, patient-centered, private-pay acupuncture and Chinese medicine clinic and am seeking a detail-oriented Medical Virtual Assistant to support patient coordination, scheduling, and daily clinic operations.



This is a high-responsibility, patient-facing role. You will function as a remote clinic coordinator and my right hand in managing communication, scheduling accuracy, and time-sensitive tasks. I am a solo practitioner, so efficiency and reliability are extremely important. You will be required to stay responsive during US business hours, but daily task volume is low. Accuracy and responsiveness are more important than speed or constant activity.



You will help keep the clinic running smoothly from the operational side while I focus on treating patients in person. This role requires proactive communication, strong attention to detail, and the ability to stay organized within a dynamic, real-time schedule.



This is not a passive role where you wait for tasks. Instead, you will be expected to stay responsive, anticipate needs, follow structured workflows, and help maintain a high level of professionalism and efficiency in all patient interactions.

This is also NOT a high-volume call center role.

We provide high-touch, premium care and value accuracy, warmth, and professionalism in all patient communication.



You will be working directly with me (the doctor), so clear communication, reliability, and attention to detail are very important at all times.



This role starts as a trial (2 weeks) with potential for long-term part-time work if it’s a good fit.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



-Respond to new patient inquiries that is time sensitive (text/email/call)

-Answer incoming calls from new and existing patients using OpenPhone (cloud phone system)

-Schedule appointments accurately within new inquiry timeframe (booking + checking completeness)

-Collect patient information (name, phone,
, reason for visit)

-Ensure intake forms are completed within required timeframe

-Send appointment confirmations and reminders

-Develop and follow structured workflow templates provided

-Create superbills with information provided

-Flag incomplete bookings or issues immediately

-Maintain organized patient communication records

-HIPAA certified 



What This Role Is NOT

-Not social media management

-Not content creation

-Not sales calls

-Not medical advice (strictly coordination only)

-This is a patient coordination and scheduling role for a healthcare clinic.



Required Skills (Please Do NOT Apply Without These)

-Excellent written and conversational English

-Strong attention to detail (VERY important)

-Experience with scheduling or appointment booking

-Ability to develop and follow workflows and templates exactly

-Professional and warm communication style

-Strong internet connection

-Experience working with medical, wellness, or healthcare clinics

-Experience with EHR or scheduling systems (JaneApp, etc.)

-Patient coordinator or medical VA experience

-Organized and reliable, always a step ahead of me



Screening Questions (REQUIRED)



Please answer the following:

-Do you have experience handling patient scheduling or appointment booking? Describe briefly.

-How do you make sure bookings are complete and accurate?

-Have you worked with a medical, wellness, or healthcare clinic before?

-Can you repeat directions back and execute without issue?

-Can you work weekdays and online during US EST business hours checking inbox 2-3 times, and check inbox and book new patients during weekends (asynchronous hours)?

-What would you do if you were unsure how to book a patient correctly?

-Confirm your internet speed and typical working hours (in your time zone)

-Are you okay with a part time range of 15-20 hours/week starting and increasing based on workload

Applications without answers to these questions will not be considered.

Comfortable asking clarification questions when unsure.



Please start your application with the phrase:

“Patient care requires accuracy.”

 • Proper exposure and color balance

 • Straight vertical lines

title: Personnal Stylist
description:
Personal Stylist – Trend-Focused & Budget-Conscious

Position Title:

Personal Stylist (Trending Fashion & Affordable Luxury Looks)

Position Summary:

We are seeking a fashion-forward Personal Stylist who specializes in curating trendy, polished looks while maintaining a smart budget. This stylist will source stylish, affordable outfits for vacations, special events, professional appearances, and everyday elevated wear.

The ideal candidate understands current fashion trends, body types, color theory, and how to create high-end aesthetics at affordable price points.

 

Key Responsibilities

• Curate complete outfits for:

o Vacation looks (resort, cruise, tropical, city trips)

o Formal events (weddings, galas, birthdays)

o Business and networking events

o Casual-chic everyday wear

• Shop both online and in-store for budget-friendly fashion

• Stay updated on current fashion trends and seasonal collections

• Source affordable alternatives to luxury designer pieces

• Create look books and mood boards for clients

• Coordinate accessories, shoes, handbags, and statement pieces

• Assist with wardrobe edits and closet organization

• Provide body-type and color-based styling recommendations

• Work within client budgets without sacrificing style

• Track sales, discount codes, and fashion deals

 

Required Skills & Qualifications

• Strong knowledge of current fashion trends

• Ability to style high-end looks on a realistic budget

• Excellent eye for color coordination and fit

• Experience with online retailers (Zara, H&M, Mango, ASOS, Amazon fashion, etc.)

• Familiarity with resale platforms (Poshmark, Shein alternatives, Fashion Nova, etc.)

• Knowledge of tailoring basics

• Strong communication skills

• Experience creating digital look books (Canva, Pinterest, etc.)

• Social media savvy (Instagram/TikTok fashion trends preferred)

 

Preferred Experience

• 1–3 years styling experience

• Portfolio of styled looks

• Experience styling for:

o Vacation wardrobes

o Professional women

o Special events

• Understanding of body positivity and inclusive sizing

 

Budget-Smart Shopping Expertise Should Include:

• Finding designer-inspired pieces under $100

• Mixing high and low fashion

• Identifying quality fabrics at affordable retailers

• Using discount codes, flash sales, and clearance sourcing

• Thrift + boutique sourcing when appropriate

 

If You Want a Shorter Version for Posting:

We are seeking a trend-savvy Personal Stylist who can curate fashionable, vacation-ready and event-ready looks on a smart budget. Must have a strong eye for detail, knowledge of trending styles, and ability to source affordable yet elevated outfits. Experience creating look books and styling complete outfits required.

 

If you’d like, I can also create:

• A contract template for hiring a stylist

• A personal stylist service description for your own business

• A budget-friendly vacation capsule wardrobe guide

• A checklist for event styling

• Or a luxury-looking but affordable vacation packing list ?

Just tell me which direction you want to go.

title: GoHighLevel Developer & Automation Specialist
description:
READ THIS ENTIRE POST BEFORE APPLYING — TEMPLATED OR AI-GENERATED APPLICATIONS WILL BE DECLINED IMMEDIATELY



POSITION: GoHighLevel Developer & Automation Specialist

Company: Automize REI

Pay: Monthly Recurring (Long-Term Role)

Platform: GoHighLevel (GHL)

Industry Focus: Real Estate Investing (Wholesaling, Flipping, Rentals)



ABOUT US



Automize REI is an AI-powered real estate investment CRM and automation platform built on GoHighLevel. We serve wholesalers, flippers, and rental property investors with a fully built-out system that includes AI voice integrations (Assistible.ai), AI SMS follow-ups, lead data integrations, disposition automations, and more. We have paying customers, a live WordPress website, and we are actively scaling into new industries beyond real estate. We are operational and growing.



WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING



This is a hands-on, backend development and operations role. Your responsibilities will include:



- Building, updating, and maintaining GHL automations, workflows, pipelines, custom fields, and sub-accounts

- Setting up and managing A2P 10DLC registration and compliance for new clients, ensuring SMS campaigns are properly configured and compliant

- Onboarding new clients onto the platform — walking them through setup, configurations, and getting them fully operational

- Providing ongoing support to existing users through calls, troubleshooting, and follow-up

- Collecting user feedback and translating it into actionable automation updates and platform improvements

- Researching and implementing new AI tools — including voice, SMS, and conversational AI — to continuously improve our system

- Writing and refining AI prompts for lead qualification, follow-up sequences, and disposition bots — must understand real prompt engineering, not copy-paste from ChatGPT

- Building and improving disposition bots that understand seller motivation, seller psychology, and real estate deal flow

- Researching cost-saving opportunities across SMS, phone, and data usage within GHL

- Updating UI/UX elements within GHL sub-accounts and snapshot configurations to improve user experience

- Helping curate and improve our WordPress website, including SEO and design updates

- Creating visual workflow diagrams and documentation of automations

- Staying ahead of GHL platform updates and proactively recommending improvements

- Supporting our data provider integration for automated lead delivery and property research within GHL





WHO THIS IS FOR



This role is for you if:



- You have hands-on GHL development experience — not theoretical, not surface-level

- You understand real estate investing: wholesaling, seller motivation, ARV, deal disposition, skip tracing, and lead follow-up

- You have experience with A2P 10DLC registration, SMS compliance, and carrier vetting

- You know how to write and engineer AI prompts from scratch — not copy-paste

- You have built disposition bots, lead qualification bots, or AI follow-up sequences

- You are comfortable on calls with clients and can communicate clearly and professionally in English

- You can onboard new users, explain complex systems simply, and provide reliable support

- You can do deep research independently and bring back concrete recommendations

- You take initiative and do not need to be micromanaged



This role is NOT for you if:



- You have never worked in real estate or with a real estate CRM

- Your GHL experience is limited to basic funnels or simple
 automations

- You have no experience with A2P compliance or SMS campaign setup

- You cannot write a real AI prompt and rely on generic ChatGPT outputs

- Your English communication skills are not strong — this role requires clear, professional written and spoken English

- You submit a copy-paste application — it will be declined without review



TRIAL PERIOD



The first phase of this engagement will be a paid trial to assess fit, communication quality, work output, and ability to hit the ground running. If you perform well, this becomes a long-term monthly recurring role.



HOW TO APPLY — REQUIRED QUESTIONS



Do NOT send a generic cover letter. Do NOT use ChatGPT to write your application. I will know, and your application will be declined immediately.



Instead, answer all of the following questions in your own words, thoroughly and specifically:



1. Why do you want this specific job? Not a generic answer — explain why Automize REI and this type of work interests you personally.



2. Describe your real estate experience. Have you worked with wholesalers, flippers, or investors? Do you understand seller motivation, disposition, ARV, or the acquisition-to-close process? Be specific.



3. Describe your GoHighLevel experience in detail. How many clients or accounts have you built in GHL? What types of automations have you built? Have you worked with sub-accounts, snapshots, custom fields, or pipelines? Give real examples.



4. What is your experience with A2P 10DLC registration and SMS compliance? Have you set up campaigns for clients? What challenges have you run into and how did you resolve them?



5. What is your experience with AI tools and prompt engineering? What AI platforms have you integrated into GHL or used for real estate? Give a specific example of a prompt you built from scratch and what it was designed to do.



6. Have you built any chatbots, disposition bots, or AI follow-up sequences? Describe the logic and flow of one you have built.



7. What is your experience with client onboarding and support? How do you handle a client who is frustrated or confused during setup?



8. What is your experience with WordPress, web design, or SEO?



PORTFOLIO REQUIREMENT



You MUST attach screenshots of GHL automations or workflows you have personally built. These must be actual screenshots from inside GoHighLevel — no planning documents, no Notion pages, no Loom previews. Real screenshots only. I will review every one of them.



If you have read this far and you are serious — we want to hear from you. This is a growing platform with real customers, real traction, and a real opportunity to be part of building something long-term. High-caliber applicants only.

description:
Digital Media Buyer Job Description



Signalytics is seeking a results-driven and analytical Digital Media Buyer to join our Amazon- managed services team. This role  is responsible for developing, executing, and optimizing advertising strategies using Amazon’s Demand Side Platform (DSP) and external media platforms. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience in Amazon DSP, digital advertising, and leveraging media buying strategies to drive high-quality traffic to Amazon product listings.

Media Strategy Development & Execution:

• Develop and implement data-driven advertising strategies on and off Amazon using DSP and other media platforms.

• Plan and execute targeted media campaigns across display, video, and audio channels.

• Utilize external platforms (e.g.,
) to redirect traffic to Amazon product listings.

Campaign Management & Optimization:

Data Analysis & Reporting:

• Track and report on key metrics, including click-through rates (CTR), conversion rates, and return on ad spend (ROAS).

 Ads, Google Ads and Media Buying

What We Offer:

title: CRO Website Designer (Healthcare)
description:
Overview



We are a U.S.-based company.



Our site is already functional — we need an expert who can turn it into a high-performing intake and consultation booking engine while keeping the existing concepts of a calm, family-centered brand feel and making it clean and performant. This is not a full rebrand. 



We are looking for a top-tier conversion designer, not a general web freelancer.



Project Goal



Redesign and optimize our website to increase:



-Consultation bookings

-Insurance inquiry form submissions

-Trust and engagement

-Mobile conversion rate



This role is for someone who understands how clients choose healthcare providers and how healthcare trust signals drive action.



What You’ll Be Doing



You will lead a conversion refresh of our website, including:



-Rewriting and restructuring the homepage for clarity + action

-Designing a stronger above-the-fold hero section with clear CTAs

-Adding trust elements (testimonials, credentials, insurance acceptance)

-Building a simple intake flow (“Free Consult ? Insurance Verify ? Start Therapy”)

-Build dedicated landing pages for different campaigns

-Improving mobile-first conversion (sticky call/book buttons)

-Creating a modern but calm healthcare aesthetic that matches our current vibe

-Ensuring every page drives toward a clear next step



Required Experience (Do Not Apply Without These)



To apply, you must have:



? Proven experience designing lead-gen websites that convert

? Experience in healthcare, therapy, pediatrics, or similar high-trust services

? Strong understanding of UX psychology and decision-making

? Ability to improve copy + layout (not just visuals)

? Portfolio showing measurable results (conversion lifts, booking increases, etc.)

? Experience with modern landing page systems (Webflow, Framer, LandingSite, Wix Studio, etc.)



This Role Is NOT For You If…



-You only do “pretty design” without a conversion strategy

-You rely on templates with generic stock layouts

-You have no experience with service-based or healthcare businesses

-You cannot explain how your work increases leads

-You don’t understand trust-building for parents



What a Successful Outcome Looks Like



Within 30 days, our site should feel like:



-A premium, trusted provider

-Clear insurance-friendly intake process

-Parents immediately trust us and know what to do next

-Higher consultation bookings and inbound calls

-Stronger emotional connection and credibility



To Apply (Filter Question — Required)

Include the following in your application:



-A link to 2–3 relevant conversion-based projects



Your answer to:

-What are the top 3 changes you would make to a booking website/landing page to increase parent consultation bookings?

-Any measurable results you’ve achieved (conversion %, leads, bookings, etc.)



Applications without these will not be reviewed.

description:
need you to find raw aviation clips and edit them into a compelling 12-15 minute yta video

$25 dollars per video (research + edited)

no longer than 2.5 - 3 hours needed, editing is very basic

are you okay with price? if not dont apply.

start your message with MAYDAY.

title: Python Developer - Automated Trading Systems
description:
We are a trading technology company building automated systems that detect price inefficiencies across betting exchanges and bookmakers. 



You will be one of two developers building and maintaining our bot infrastructure. You will work directly with the founder, receiving clear strategy specifications, and you will build the systems that execute them.

This is backend automation, API integration, real-time data processing, and systems work. Not web development or app building.



What You Will Build

 • Python bots interacting with the Betfair Exchange API (REST + Streaming)

 • Real-time odds scraping and parsing from bookmaker comparison sites

 • Scheduling and timing logic — bots must fire at precise windows before events

 • Data logging and storage (PostgreSQL/SQLite) with pandas analysis pipelines

 •
 bot integration for signal delivery to subscribers

 • Integration with Polymarket and Kalshi APIs (REST + WebSocket)

 • Monitoring and alerting — you will know immediately when something breaks



Note: The above software are suggestions. They don't need to be done on there if you have better alternatives or preferred workflows. That's okay as long as it all works. 



Required Skills (Must Have ALL)

 • 3+ years Python development

 • Strong REST API and WebSocket experience

 • Web scraping experience (BeautifulSoup, Selenium, or Playwright)

 • Database experience (PostgreSQL or SQLite) and data analysis with pandas

 • Task scheduling and automation (cron, APScheduler, or equivalent)

 • Can work autonomously with clear specs — you receive the logic, you build the system

 • Strong debugging skills — you can diagnose a 2am crash from logs alone

 • Fluent written English



Big Plus (Not Required)

 • Betting/trading systems or exchange API experience

 • Betfair API or Flumine framework knowledge

 •
 Bot API experience

 • Crypto/blockchain API experience (Polymarket, Kalshi)

 • Understanding of probability and expected value concepts



Working Arrangement

 • Full-time (40 hours/week), must overlap UK afternoon (1pm-5pm GMT) for daily standups

 • Fully remote

 • Direct Slack/Telegram communication with founder

 • Start with 3-day paid trial at full daily rate



How to Apply

To be considered, include ALL of the following:

 • Write the word "PROBE" at the top of your application

 • Your CV highlighting Python and API integration experience

 • Link to GitHub profile or a code sample showing API integration work

 • In 2-3 sentences: Describe a Python system you built that needed to run reliably without supervision. What broke, and how did you fix it?



Applications missing any of the 4 items above will not be reviewed. We respond to qualified applicants within 24 hours.

title: IMMEDIATE HIRE: Content Editor/Writer (WFH/Dayshift) - Lots of Benefits & Flexibility
description:
180 Marketing, a leading e-commerce SEO company, is currently looking for a Content Editor. This is a 100% work-from-home position that offers great pay and benefits.



Apply by filling out this form:



Watch our 3-minute video with more information about 180 Marketing and the Content Editor position: 



Content Editors are responsible for ensuring the written content is proofread, edited, and returned to the Project Managers within the allotted timeframe. You may also be called upon to write content on occasion, as necessary.



Roles and Responsibilities

- Proofread and edit blog content, product and category pages, news items, and more

- Fact-check content 

- Manage your own internal workflow of writing projects

- Assist with writing for time-sensitive assignments when necessary



Benefits

- P30,000 - P40,000, dependent on experience

- HMO after 6-month probationary period

- 10 days* of paid leave each year

- 10 days of paid public holidays each year

- Up to 10% end of year bonus payment

- Extensive SEO & Content Marketing training (paid to learn)



Requirements

- Excellent written and verbal English skills

- Minimum of 2 years of writing, proofreading, copyediting OR content editing experience

- Background in SEO, digital marketing, or e-commerce marketing is a plus

- Ability to understand and adhere to world-class writing and brand guidelines



About 180 Marketing



With offices the United States, 180 Marketing is one of the leading SEO companies in the world. We have a talented team of experts who have cracked the code on Google's ranking factors, AI SEO and we consistently deliver outstanding results. As a result, our clients love us, and we have very high client retention with amazing testimonials and case studies.



We offer a great work environment, great salary with bonuses, extensive training and huge opportunities for growth.

title: Meta Partnership Ads ad publisher Specialist (9am–12pm AEST)
description:
Role Overview

This is an ad publishing (not strategist role)



We are looking for a highly organised and detail-oriented Meta Ads Specialist to manage the end-to-end execution/publishing of our Partnership Ads.



This is a high-volume, process-driven role. You will be responsible for publishing approximately 20 ads per day, managing usage rights, and coordinating closely with our Influencer Marketing team to ensure all assets and permissions are ready for launch.



Key Responsibilities

Ad Publishing: Launching ~20 Partnership Ads daily within Meta Ads Manager.

Request Management: Sending and tracking Partnership Ad requests to influencer accounts.

Usage Rights Tracking: Maintaining an organized system to monitor usage term end dates and ensuring no ads run past their legal limit.

Cross-Team Coordination: Communicating daily with our Influencer Marketing team to gather missing information, creative assets, or access.

Troubleshooting: Identifying and resolving issues with creator permissions or Meta Business Suite connections.



Requirements

Meta Ads Manager Expertise: You must have hands-on experience specifically with Partnership Ads (Branded Content).

Time Zone & Schedule: Must be available to work fixed hours between 9:00 AM and 12:00 PM AEST (Sydney Time), Monday through Friday.

Extreme Organisation: You will be handling high volumes of data; you must have a proven system for tracking deadlines and statuses.

Communication: Fluent English and the ability to work collaboratively with a remote team in real-time.

Reliability: This is a daily operation; we need someone who can commit to a steady, long-term routine.



Project Details

Hours: 3–4 hours per day (Strictly during Sydney mornings).

Budget: $18 AUD / hour.

Location: Remote, but must be able to commit to the AEST schedule.

Duration: Ongoing, long-term collaboration.

title: Personal Cook/Assistant
description:
Job title Personal Household Cook (Personal Chef + 2x a day, Dog Walking)

Employment Type Full Time

Location BGC

Client Nationality American

Stay in/ out Stay Out

But staff quarters will be provided for rest breaks (shower, toilet, rest area)

Schedule Monday - Saturday

8am Start, to have 9 am Breakfast ready 6 pm Departure

~Occasional requirement to work overtime if there are guests coming over on a Sat or Sun evening.

Salary TBD

Job Description How you’ll make an impact

We are hiring a reliable and experienced Personal Household Cook (Personal Chef) to

prepare healthy, Western-style meals and support daily household errands related to food

and basic supplies. This role is best for someone who enjoys cooking nutritious meals

consistently, is organized with shopping and ingredients, and is comfortable caring for a

small dog.

Key Responsibilities:

Healthy Meal Preparation (Western-Style)?  Prepare healthy Western-style meals using techniques such as steaming, air frying,

oven baking, grilling, and light sautéing.

Prepare daily meals with consistency and good portioning

Maintain freshness and proper food storage (labeling and organizing leftovers when

helpful).

Meal Planning and Customization

Build on an existing meal plan while suggesting new healthy recipes.

Coordinate with the client to align meals with dietary preferences and any

restrictions.

Grocery Shopping and Household Shopping Errands

Purchase groceries and high-quality ingredients (fresh produce, proteins,

health-conscious options).

Run misc shopping errands as requested (basic household items, quick pickups,

etc.).

Track what’s running low and keep a simple running list for restocking.



Meal Presentation

Ensure meals are clean, appealing, and served properly.

Kitchen Cleanliness and Organization (Only Cleaning Scope)

Keep the kitchen clean and organized during and after cooking.

Wash dishes used for cooking, wipe counters, clean cooking surfaces, and maintain

basic organization of the pantry/fridge related to meal prep.

Dog Walking and Care

Walk a small poodle twice daily (morning and afternoon).

When the employer travels, you will be paid your full rate to care for the dog.



Key Requirements:

Fluent in English (Non-Negotiable): Must be fluent in spoken and written English.

Healthy Western Cooking Experience: Proven experience in preparing healthy

Western dishes (salads, baked dishes, steamed meals, air-fried meals, grilled items,

etc.).

Strong Meal Planning Ability: Can propose meal ideas, rotate meals, and keep Food choices healthy and varied.

title: QA Automation Engineer (Cypress or Similar)
description:
Job Title: QA Automation Engineer (Remote – Philippines)

Location: Remote – Philippines

Company: EETech



About EETech



EETech is a dynamic technology company committed to delivering innovative digital commerce solutions. Our global team collaborates to create cutting-edge platforms that drive success for our clients. We value creativity, technical excellence, and a forward-thinking approach to solving complex challenges.





Job Overview

EETech is looking for a skilled QA Automation Engineer to ensure our software products are robust, efficient, and ready for production. In this remote role, you will design and develop automated test scripts, integrate testing frameworks into our CI/CD pipelines, and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to improve product quality. This position is ideal for a proactive engineer who is passionate about leveraging automation to drive continuous improvement in quality assurance.





Key Responsibilities

• Test Automation Development:

o Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts for web and mobile applications.

o Implement automated testing frameworks and integrate them with existing CI/CD pipelines.



• Quality Assurance & Continuous Improvement:

o Collaborate with development and product teams to identify test requirements and ensure comprehensive test

coverage.

o Analyze test results, track issues, and work with the team to resolve defects promptly.



• Framework & Tool Enhancement:

o Evaluate and implement new automation tools and best practices to enhance testing efficiency and accuracy.

o Maintain and update existing test suites in response to new feature developments or changes.



• Documentation & Reporting:

o Create detailed test plans, test cases, and technical documentation to support automation efforts.

o Provide clear, concise reports on test outcomes, quality metrics, and areas for improvement.



• Collaboration & Agile Practices:

o Actively participate in agile ceremonies, including daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives.

o Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure timely delivery of high-quality software solutions.





Qualifications

• Technical Skills:

o Proficiency in programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, or Java.

o Strong experience with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Appium).

o Familiarity with CI/CD tools and processes (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD).



• Experience:

o Proven track record in automating test cases for web and mobile applications.

o Experience in a remote work environment with effective communication and time management skills.



• Soft Skills:

o Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detail.

o Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.



• Preferred Qualifications:

o Experience with performance and load testing tools is a plus.

o Knowledge of agile development methodologies and continuous testing practices.





What We Offer

• Remote Work Flexibility:

o Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere in the Philippines while collaborating with a global team.

• Collaborative Environment:

o Be part of an innovative, team-oriented culture that values technical excellence and continuous improvement.

title: Frontend Developer (React.js and TypeScript)
description:

Location: Remote – Philippines

Company: EETech



Company Overview:

EETech is a dynamic technology company committed to delivering innovative digital commerce solutions. Our global team collaborates to create cutting-edge platforms that drive success for our clients. We value creativity, technical excellence, and a forward-thinking approach to solving complex challenges.



Job Overview:

EETech is seeking a talented and passionate React Developer to join our remote team. In this role, you will design and develop responsive, user-friendly web applications using React.js, contributing to high-quality digital solutions that drive business success. If you are a proactive developer with a keen eye for detail and a strong commitment to excellence, we invite you to become a key player in our growing organization.





Key Responsibilities

• Front-End Development:

o Develop scalable and maintainable web applications using React.js.

o Translate UI/UX designs into high-quality code while ensuring optimal performance.



• Component Architecture:

o Build reusable and modular components following best practices.

o Collaborate with designers and back-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.

o Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.

o Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.



• Collaboration & Agile Practices:

o Participate in daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and code reviews.

o Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.



• Continuous Improvement:

o Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve application performance and user experience.

What We Offer
