• Collaborative Environment:

o Work in a forward-thinking, innovative environment that values technical excellence and teamwork.



How to apply

Kindly send your cover letter and updated resume.

title: Social Media Manager
description:
SUMMARY



We are seeking a Social Media Manager who will be responsible for creating content and developing strategies that drive creator growth and brand impact. This role combines creativity with data-driven decision-making, crafting engaging content, optimizing influencer collaborations, and supporting creators to grow their audience and influence.



RESPONSIBILITIES



- Plan, launch, and optimize influencer marketing campaigns across specific assigned social media platforms

- Collaborate with internal teams to align influencer initiatives with brand campaigns, product and launches

- Track, measure, and report campaign performance using key metrics such as reach, engagement, conversions, and ROI.

- Stay updated on social media trends, platform updates, and emerging creators to keep campaigns fresh and competitive.

- Experiment with new formats (e.g., livestreams, co-branded content, affiliate partnerships) to drive growth and engagement.



QUALIFICATIONS



- Fluent in English (written and spoken)

- PREFERRED: 2+ years of experience in social media management, influencer coordination, or content scheduling

- Familiar with posting and scheduling on social media

- Quick learner who follows instructions well

- Highly organized and able to manage multiple accounts simultaneously

- Strong communication and teamwork skills

title: Remote Copywriter for Short Form Content (Philippines Time Zone)
description:
We are looking for a dependable copywriter who is fluent in English, has a background in marketing, is familiar with social media content, and is seeking a remote role Monday through Saturday. You will be trained to rewrite high performing viral Instagram Reels into scripts tailored for our agency’s clients.



Availability



This role requires availability Monday through Saturday.



Ideally between 9:30 AM and 5:30 PM Philippines time, though later working hours can be arranged for candidates who prefer an evening schedule.



Requirements



- Fluent in English, mandatory requirement

- Experience in marketing or copywriting, mandatory requirement

- Very responsive and reliable on WhatsApp

- Able to learn quickly and follow systems

- Comfortable using tools such as Notion, Claude, ChatGPT, and Google Workspace

- Able to work independently using provided training and documentation



Compensation



- The position begins with a paid training period lasting approximately 2 to 4 weeks

- During training, you will be paid per short form script at a starting rate of 130 PHP per script

- As your speed and quality improve, pay may increase up to 290 PHP per script

- For trainees, a script may take up to 1 hour to complete

- Experienced copywriters typically complete a script in 15 to 30 minutes

- Over time, if we work well together, compensation may transition to a fixed monthly salary



The exact rate progression will be discussed once training is completed.



Marketing Knowledge Expectation



Applicants should be familiar with common marketing and social media concepts such as pain points, ideal client profile (ICP), target audience, hooks, calls to action (CTA), value proposition, engagement tactics, and conversion focused content.



How to Apply



To apply, please reply with the following information:



1. Your WhatsApp number

2. Confirmation that you are available during the listed time windows

3. Your background in marketing and social media

4. The smartphone model you use

5. The laptop model you use

6. A Google Drive link containing a screenshot of your internet speed test results. Make sure the link is set to “Anyone with the link.”



Thank you for your interest. We will review applications and contact shortlisted candidates.

title: Marketing Content Creator (AI-Powered) — Remote | $1,000–$2,000/month USD
description:
We're AdFlux — a fast-growing AI video ad platform that helps marketers create scroll-stopping Meta ads in minutes instead of days. Think of us as the fastest path from brief to live ad.

We're hiring a remote marketing content creator to join a small, high-output team. This isn't a big corporate job. You'll have real ownership, work directly with the founder, and see your work go live fast.



What you'll actually do day-to-day:

Write ad scripts and UGC-style hooks for Meta campaigns. Build
 sequences for trial users, leads, and re-engagement. Create lead magnets and content offers that drive signups. Ghost-write LinkedIn and Instagram content on behalf of marketing influencers. Use Apify to scrape and build targeted
 lists for outbound campaigns. Research what's working in the market and adapt it for AdFlux campaigns.



You're the right person if:

You use AI tools every day and know how to get great output, not just first drafts. You can switch tone — from punchy ad copy to conversational
 to authentic influencer voice. You move fast and don't wait for perfect. You've written copy that has actually run as an ad,
, or social post (portfolio required). You're comfortable with scraping tools or willing to learn them fast. Your English writing is clean, natural, and human-sounding.



We don't care about:

Your degree. How many years of "experience" you have on paper. Whether you've worked at a big agency. If your work is good and you're fast, that's all that matters.



Tools we use and expect you to know (or learn fast):

ChatGPT / Claude, Apify, Meta Ads Library, Google Docs, Notion. Bonus if you've used any AI video or creative tools before.



How this works:

We run a simple 2-step process so we're not wasting anyone's time.

Step 1 — Fill out a short application form (2 minutes, link below). Step 2 — Top applicants will be sent a short async video screen (record on your own time, no scheduling). Step 3 — Final candidates do a 30-minute live skills test with real tasks, real tools, no trick questions.

We move fast. If you apply and you're a fit, you'll hear back within 48 hours.

title: Strategic Sales Partner
description:
* ** Please apply for this position using the following URL: 
 ***



ABOUT KAITERRA:

We spend 90% of our time indoors, where air quality directly impacts our health, well-being, and overall comfort.

At Kaiterra, we believe our buildings should not only be safe and healthy but also enhance the quality of life for those inside them. That’s why we create innovative environmental monitoring devices and intelligent software analytics, combined with world-class professional consultation services, to help leading companies worldwide transform their built environments.

Our clients include some of the world’s most respected companies—Microsoft, LinkedIn, Google, and Apple, to name a few. They come to us for solutions to complex challenges in their environments, and we work with them to create healthier, safer, and smarter spaces.

If you’re looking to join a purpose-driven organization making a tangible impact on the human experience, Kaiterra could be the perfect fit for you.



ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are seeking a high-caliber Strategic Sales Partner to act as the primary operational engine for our Senior Account Executive. You are the "Chief of Staff" for our most complex deal cycles.

This is not a standard virtual assistant role. You are the "operational brain" of the sales cycle, responsible for synthesizing complex information into strategic action. You don't just follow a process; you project manage and steer the process that moves deals forward with clients like Google and Microsoft.



Location: Remote (Philippines / Vietnam / Thailand preferred) 

Job Type: Full-Time (Must overlap with North American Business Hours) 

Reporting to: Senior Account Executive



WHAT YOU'LL DO:



Strategic Deal Synthesis & Risk Identification: 

Attend client meetings and forecast calls to capture "unspoken" nuances. You convert raw meeting notes and AE "brain dumps" into structured, executive-level action plans and tasks while proactively identifying potential "deal-breakers" (e.g., missing technical stakeholders or procurement hurdles). You manage the chasing and completion of these tasks and get help from whichever tea
mber is required internally.



Commercial Pipeline Hygiene: 

Own the "Source of Truth" in the CRM (HubSpot/Salesforce). You are responsible for 100% data integrity, ensuring every deal stage, close date, and opportunity reflects the current reality without the AE ever having to manually enter data.



Operational Intelligence: 

Build and maintain org charts and dossiers on key decision-makers. You ensure the AE never walks into a meeting without a comprehensive briefing on the client's strategic priorities.



The "Time Defender": 

Strategically manage the AE’s inbox and calendar using Google Workspace. You prioritize high-value client communication and draft "executive-ready" replies, ensuring no VIP client is left waiting.



Internal Navigation: 

Drive the deal process internally by pushing paperwork through Legal, Finance, and Security teams to ensure zero deal stagnation.



WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

- Education: Bachelor’s Degree required.

- Experience: 2+ years in a high-performance professional environment. We highly value backgrounds in Management Consulting, Business Operations, or as a Founder’s Associate.

- Technical Precision: Mastery of CRM (HubSpot/Salesforce) and Google Workspace.

- Strategic AI Usage: You use Gemini/AI as a force multiplier for research and synthesis, never as a crutch. You fact-check every output for accuracy and human tone.

title: SEO LEAD
description:
Role Overview



We are hiring an SEO Team Lead to own and grow our SEO department.



This is not just a technical role.



You will:



Lead SEO strategy across multiple clients



Manage and mentor SEO specialists and content writers



Build scalable SEO systems and processes



Connect SEO performance to real business outcomes



Work closely with the founder and leadership team



You must think strategically and execute consistently.



Key Responsibilities

1. Strategy & Planning



Develop 6–12 month SEO roadmaps



Create cluster and topical authority strategies



Build local SEO strategies for service-based businesses



Align SEO with revenue and lead targets



2. Team Leadership



Manage and mentor SEO specialists



Oversee content writers and editors



Review and improve briefs before execution



Run internal SEO meetings



Improve team processes and documentation



You will be responsible for performance and quality.

Site architecture



Internal linking strategies



Schema implementation



Core Web Vitals



Indexation and crawl management



Redirect and migration planning



GBP optimization and local signals



4. Data & Reporting



Use GA4 and Search Console daily



Track conversions and attribution



Translate SEO metrics into business impact



Identify performance drops and growth opportunities



Present results confidently to clients



5. Process & Systems



Build repeatable SEO SOPs



Implement sprint-based SEO workflows



Use AI tools to improve efficiency



Improve reporting systems





Maintain task accountability through ClickUp or similar tools



Requirements

Experience



4+ years in SEO



Experience leading or mentoring a team



Proven local SEO results



Experience with service-based or local businesses



Agency Experience is a must



Skills



Strong technical SEO knowledge



Ability to create scalable content systems



Clear communication skills



Comfortable leading client calls



Strong analytical mindset



Familiar with AI tools and automation



Work Structure



Remote position



Must overlap at least 3–5 hours with Canada West Coast business hours



Ability to attend strategy calls during PST time zone when required



What We Are Looking For



We want someone who:



Thinks like a business owner



Cares about measurable impact



Takes ownership without being micromanaged



Can challenge weak strategy respectfully



Is calm under pressure



Wants to build something long-term



This is a leadership position, not a junior SEO role.

Leadership authority in the SEO department



Freedom to build systems



Opportunity to scale with the company



Competitive compensation based on experience and performance

A sample content brief

title: Senior AI Automation Engineer (At least 3+ Years n8n Experience
description:
We are a Hong Kong–based AI Automation & n8n consultancy, focused on building real, production-grade automation systems — not demos, not experiments.



We have previously delivered automation projects for a range of organizations, including:



-A Hong Kong listed company (internal process and system automation)

- One of the largest online live-commerce / streaming companies in Hong Kong (sales, operations, and content automation)

-Professional service firms (insurance, engineering, consulting)

-E-commerce brands (Shopify / Shopline)



The Role

We are looking for a  A+ Player Senior AI Automation Engineer who can work independently, think in systems, and deliver high-quality automation solutions.



This is a long-term collaboration, not a short-term freelance gig.(Strong performance may lead to a full-time position.)



What You’ll Be Working On

-Designing and building production-grade n8n workflows

-Deep integration with third-party APIs

-REST APIs

-Webhooks

-OAuth2 / token refresh logic

-Building automation systems such as:

-CRM & lead management pipelines

-Invoice, reporting & reminder systems

-AI-powered content pipelines (text / image / video)

-Internal AI knowledge systems

-Collaborating across frontend, backend, and databases — or handling them yourself

-Turning manual business processes into scalable systems



Requirements (Must-Have)

At least 3 years of real-world experience using n8n in production

Strong experience with API integrations

Solid understanding of:

REST APIs

Webhooks

OAuth2 authentication flows

Full-stack mindset

Basic frontend understanding

Backend logic & system design

Databases (e.g. Supabase, PostgreSQL, MySQL)



Ability to:

Analyze requirements independently

Design clean, scalable automation architectures

Build workflows that are maintainable long-term

Nice to Have (Bonus)

Experience integrating AI / LLMs (OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, etc.)

Experience with Shopify, HubSpot, WhatsApp automation

Strong business logic understanding (not just technical execution)



This Role Is NOT For You If

You need constant supervision to produce decent work

If your output only looks good when someone is checking every detail, fixing your logic, or repeatedly reminding you of basic standards —this role is not for you.We work with people who hold themselves to a standard, even when no one is watching.



If your mindset is:

“Just tell me what to do”

“I’ll do the minimum required”

“I’m not interested in getting better, only getting paid”

Then this role is definitely not for you.



What We Offer

Long-term collaboration (At Least 4 Month)

Fully remote, results-driven work

Extremely Competitive and fair compensation based on skill level

(If you’re the talent we’re looking for, tell us your number — we’ll do our best to keep you.?







Our Current Stage & Team

We are an early-stage startup, currently operating with a lean but highly experienced technical team.

Our core team includes:

A Senior IT Engineer with 7+ years of hands-on experience, responsible for system infrastructure, integrations, and reliability

A Senior Full-Stack Engineer with 20+ years of experience, leading architecture, system design, and complex implementation work

We intentionally keep the team small, senior, and execution-focused. Every engineer works on real systems, real clients, and real business impact — not internal demos or experimental work.



This is a great environment for someone who wants to work alongside experienced engineers, contribute at a system level, and grow with the company long-term.

title: Full Time Photo & Video Editor for Real Estate Media Agency
description:
We are a growing real estate media and marketing agency looking for a full time photo and video editor to join our team long term.



This is a production focused role for someone fast, consistent, and detail oriented. You will be editing real estate photos, short form videos, and marketing content for agents, businesses, and personal brands.







Compensation Structure



This is a full time position with a target monthly earning of around $1,200, based on consistent output.



Pay is calculated per project:



Photo Editing

• $0.25 to $0.50 per photo

Rate depends on complexity and type of edit



Video Editing Rates



• Basic Trimming – $5

Simple cuts and clean up



• Entertainment Style / Highlight Edits – $8

Fast paced, engaging edits with music and strong pacing



• Talking Head Videos with Captions – $15

60 to 90 second videos with captions and clean pacing



• Longer Form Videos – $35

3 to 5 minute videos with structure, pacing, b roll, music, and polish



You will receive clear editing guides and references for each style. Editors who can handle volume efficiently and maintain quality can reach the target monthly pay.







What You’ll Be Editing



Real Estate Photo Editing

• Exposure and color correction

• Window pulls

• Sky replacements

• Basic retouching



Video Editing

• Talking head videos

• Reels and highlight videos

• Basic trims and longer form content

• Matching our brand editing style



Raw files will be delivered via Dropbox, and finished edits will be submitted through our workflow system.







Requirements



• Strong experience in photo editing

• Strong experience in video editing

• Able to follow editing guides and match style references

• Fast turnaround times

• Reliable internet for large file transfers

• Detail oriented and consistent







Nice to Have



• Real estate editing experience

• Experience editing for social media

• Familiar with Dropbox and 







How to Apply



Please include:

 1. A short intro about yourself

 2. Your photo editing portfolio

 3. Your video editing portfolio

 4. What editing software you use

 5. Your average turnaround time

 6. The word EDIT PRO in your application



We are looking for someone dependable who wants steady, long term work and can grow with our team.

title: Senior Executive Assistant to the CEO with Project Management Experience
description:
Job Title: Executive Assistant to the CEO with Project Management Experience



Salary: Negotiable with an increase within 5 months after probationary period

Location: Remote (Full-time, CST Hours)

Start Date: Immediate

Perks: 10 paid PTO days per year



About the Role:

We are seeking a high-caliber Executive Virtual Assistant to support a fast-moving founder across multiple personal and professional initiatives. This role blends project coordination, information management, research, and executive support.



The ideal candidate is a jack of all trades with strong judgment, excellent communication, and comfort working across many types of projects. Prior experience in every task is not required—transferable skills, adaptability, and reliability matter more than a perfect resume.



What You’ll Work On:

Organizing and maintaining project materials, documents, and reference files

Managing meeting transcripts, notes, and follow-ups

Capturing ideas, links, and voice notes, and turning them into organized, usable records

Supporting multiple projects by tracking context, open items, and next steps

Conducting research and organizing data for future reference

Assisting with personal knowledge management and learning materials

Providing general executive support to help projects move forward smoothly

This role requires comfort jumping between different types of work while keeping everything organized and accessible.



Key Skills & Attributes:

Core Skills:

Excellent written and verbal communication

Strong organizational and documentation skills

High attention to detail and follow-through

Ability to manage multiple priorities and shifting requests

Comfort working with incomplete or ambiguous instructions



Technical & Research Skills (Non-Coding):

Strong proficiency with Google Drive, Docs, and Sheets

Comfortable learning and using new tools and software

Experience with research, data organization, and summarization

Familiarity with transcription tools, AI tools, or knowledge-management systems is a plus



Personal Traits:

Proactive and dependable

Calm under pressure and ambiguity

Discreet and trustworthy with sensitive information

Systems-oriented thinker who enjoys creating order



Who This Role Is For:



Someone who enjoys variety and problem-solving

Thinks in systems, not just tasks

Wants to grow into a high-impact assistant role

Can support both personal and professional workflows



Who This Role Is Not For:

title: Car Rental Sales & Customer Service
description:
We are a Michigan-based car rental and auto repair company seeking a **highly reliable and detail-oriented virtual assistant** to handle customer inquiries, rental coordination, and problem resolution. You’ll work directly with customers who want to rent vehicles or are experiencing issues with their current rental.



This is a **full-time role (50 hours/week)**. You must be available to work **5 days per week, including Saturdays and Sundays**, with the ability to work as late as **10 PM Eastern Time**.



### Responsibilities:



* Respond promptly to inbound customer requests (calls, texts, and messages) regarding car rentals

* Troubleshoot rental issues (e.g., car won’t start, flat tire) and coordinate roadside assistance or towing

* Coordinate maintenance or repair needs with our auto repair team

* Schedule vehicles and update customer records

* Follow up with renters and maintain accurate communication logs



### Qualifications:



* Excellent spoken and written English

* Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills

* Experience in customer service, preferably with cars, rentals, or logistics

* High-speed internet, noise-canceling headset, and a quiet workspace

* Tech-savvy and able to learn new tools quickly (e.g., CRM, text/call software, GPS tracking systems)



---



### **IMPORTANT – HOW TO APPLY:**



To show us you pay attention to detail and follow instructions, **please include the word “watermelon” in your subject line or response title**.



At the **very top** of your application, answer all of the following:



1. What time zone you’re located in

2. What your expected hourly rate is (in USD)

3. What days/hours you are available to work (please confirm weekend availability)

4. Send me a recording discussing your work history starting in 2018. Start with 2018 and discuss where you worked, what the company did, and what your role in the company was and then why you left, and then move forward in time.



**Applications without these details or the word “watermelon” will be ignored.**

title: marketing assistant
description:
About Us



Slimeatory is a fast-growing creative retail & entertainment brand with physical stores, an online shop, gaming apps, and a worldwide fan community. We’re known for our **DIY Slime Bar, slime parties, seasonal activations, and digital content**. Our marketing is the heartbeat of our brand—making sure every campaign, video, ad, and event connects with our audience.



We’re building a **world-class Marketing Department** and are hiring **Marketing Managers & Specialists across multiple roles**. Whether your strengths are in **in-store marketing, digital ads, social content, influencer partnerships, PR & events, or gaming apps**, we want to hear from you.



Open Tracks / Roles



Applicants may be considered for one or more of the following positions depending on skills & experience:



* **Physical Store Marketing Manager** – In-store promotions, signage, foot traffic, loyalty programs

* **Digital Marketing Manager** – Ads, SEO,
, SMS, website optimization

* **Social Media & Content Manager** – TikTok, YouTube, Instagram, content calendar, virality

* **Influencer & Partnerships Manager** – Creator collabs, affiliates, influencer campaigns

* **PR & Events Manager** – Media coverage, community events, press campaigns

* **Game App Marketing Manager** – Slimeatory app promotions, crossovers with stores & products



What You’ll Do



Depending on your track, responsibilities may include:



* Driving in-store traffic & customer engagement

* Managing paid ads, SEO,
, and SMS campaigns

* Growing our social media community with viral content

* Building influencer and affiliate relationships

* Coordinating PR, media, and community events

* Marketing and monetizing Slimeatory’s gaming apps



What We’re Looking For



* 2–5+ years experience in marketing (retail, digital, content, or related fields)

* Strong understanding of trends, customer engagement, and brand storytelling

* Creative eye + ability to execute quickly

* Organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable with deadlines

* Proficiency in tools such as Canva, Adobe Suite, Shopify, Klaviyo, Google Ads, Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, or similar (depending on role)



Why Join Us



* Be part of a **fast-growing, fun, and creative brand**

* Work across multiple channels: retail, digital, content, gaming, and influencer marketing

* Opportunity to **specialize in your strengths** while contributing to a bigger team vision

* Creative freedom and ownership over projects

* A supportive family-style culture with room to grow as the brand expands



How to Apply



Submit your **resume and portfolio (if applicable)**. Please highlight your strongest skills and experiences—whether that’s in digital, in-store, content, events, or influencer marketing. We’ll review applications and place candidates into the role(s) that best fit their strengths.

title: Licensed Accountant (US Account)
description:
We are a U.S.-based company seeking a dynamic and resourceful Licensed Accountant (CPA preferred) to join our team. This is a full-time, remote position that requires working during graveyard shifts to align with U.S. business hours 9am-5pm (PST). The selected candidate must dedicate their full professional capacity to this role and must not have other active clients or commitments.



Key Responsibilities:

Daily Bookkeeping and Account Management: Record and categorize transactions, maintain accurate ledgers, and reconcile bank, credit card, and other financial accounts.



Advanced Financial Analysis and Reporting: Prepare detailed monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, highlighting key insights and trends to inform business decisions.



Line-of-Business Expertise: Learn the company’s operations, services, and revenue model to provide tailored accounting and financial solutions.



Problem-Solving and Optimization: Identify inefficiencies in financial workflows and propose innovative solutions to enhance accuracy and productivity.



Compliance and Accuracy: Ensure strict compliance with U.S. accounting standards, tax laws, and company policies.



Budgeting and Forecasting: Assist in developing budgets, forecasting cash flows, and monitoring financial performance.



Audit and Tax Preparation: Support audits and tax filings by maintaining comprehensive and organized records.





Qualifications:

- Licensed Accountant (CPA strongly preferred).

- Strong proficiency in QuickBooks Online, Microsoft Excel, and Google Sheets (including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization tools).

- Proven ability to adapt to new industries and learn the specifics of a company’s business model.

- Demonstrated problem-solving skills and a creative, out-of-the-box approach to accounting and financial management.

- Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in financial record-keeping.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills for effective collaboration and reporting.

- Ability to manage time effectively, meet deadlines, and work independently with minimal supervision.

- Familiarity with U.S. GAAP and tax regulations is a plus.

- Must not have other active clients or professional commitments.



What We’re Looking For:

A candidate who is eager to be trained on our specific line of business and can quickly adapt to its unique financial requirements.

Someone who leverages their accounting expertise to suggest and implement practical, cost-effective solutions that benefit the company.

A proactive, forward-thinking individual who adds value beyond routine accounting tasks.



What We Offer:

Competitive salary with opportunities for growth.

A supportive, collaborative, and flexible remote work environment.

The opportunity to make a significant impact in a growing company within a dynamic industry.



If you’re an innovative accountant who thrives in fast-paced environments and is ready to take on a role where your expertise is valued and expanded, we’d love to hear from you!



Apply today to join our team.

title: AI-Powered Video Content Modernisation
description:
1. Project Overview & Trial Scope



We are an established Human Resources Consulting practice in Australia with online module content. We have reconfigured two core courses ach of them needing an avatar and a specific voice over that mimics our speaker who appears on other videos as a live presenter. 



Pilot Goal: To adapt one (1) trial video into a new format where the entire audio is replaced by the speaker's cloned voice, and the visuals feature AI-generated B-roll and a Custom AI Avatar of the speaker (sample will be provided).



Content Library State: We currently subscribed to ElevenLabs and HeyGen and can give you access to those subscriptions for this work and access to existing scripts. The average duration is approximately 4.6 minutes per video.





2. Key Creative Deliverables for the Trial Video



The contractor must deliver a fully edited video that meets these outcomes:



-Audio Replacement (Voice Cloning is Required): The contractor must use AI Voice Cloning technology to create the new voiceover in a voice cloned to sound like the original speaker. Same Australian accent (ideally)



-Custom AI Avatar Creation: Integrate a Custom AI Avatar (or digital spokesperson) to deliver key parts of the new narrative. The Avatar must be generated based on one of the following specifications:

   -An avatar generated to look like the original speaker



-Visual Enhancement (AI B-Roll): Generate new video clips (B-roll) using text prompts. These AI clips must be seamlessly edited over the speaker's footage to enhance the narrative.

  

-Final Delivery: Provide the final, high-resolution MP4 video file and a folder containing all original source files and all generated AI assets as the pilot and if successful for each video thereafter.





3. Tools & Collaboration (Flexible Workflow & Ownership)



We require the AI generation to use our system, but the assembly can use the contractor's preferred editor.



-Tool Flexibility and Editing Software: The contractor has the flexibility to use their preferred professional video editing software for the assembly of the final video. The contractor may also use their own preferred tools for initial preparation, but all final AI B-roll and script creation must be accounted for using the client-provided AI access (Note: We subscribed to HeyGen and ElevenLabs).





4. Contractor Profile



We require a highly creative, technically proficient editor who can demonstrate mastery in advanced production workflows and cutting-edge Generative AI techniques, who can also deal with quality, volume and working to deadlines:



-Required Skills: Proven expertise in professional video editing and high-fidelity AI Voice Cloning for precise voice replication and audio integration. At least Intermediate English Skills, written and verbal.



-AI-Powered Asset Creation: Expertise in prompting and directing generative image and video AI tools (e.g., Veo 3, HeyGen or similar) to acquire highly specific, and visually consistent assets.

title: PRODUCTION COORDINATOR SORORITY APPAREL
description:
PRODUCTION COORDINATOR

We're hiring an experienced Production Coordinator to manage the behind-the-scenes operations that keep our orders moving. This is a hands-on role that sits at the center of our supplier relationships, order flow, and production quality.

We specialize in custom apparel for college sororities and fraternities across the United States. Greek life organizations operate on tight, event-driven timelines — think Bid Day, recruitment week, formal season, and chapter events — where hundreds to thousands of garments need to be produced, approved, and delivered within strict windows. There is very little room for error, and the pace is unlike most apparel businesses.

This role is only open to candidates currently working or with direct past experience in the Greek apparel industry. If you have not worked with sorority or fraternity clients in a production, operations, or sourcing capacity, please do not apply.

Your day-to-day will include:



Communicating directly with suppliers and overseas factories

Placing, organizing, and tracking orders end-to-end

Sourcing materials and products based on client needs

Reviewing design files before production to ensure accuracy and quality

Organizing and packaging information for suppliers to minimize errors and delays

Coordinating approvals, revisions, timelines, and deadlines

Managing MOQs, lead times, and production limitations across multiple orders simultaneously



This role requires strong organizational skills, sharp attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple supplier relationships without things slipping through the cracks.

Compensation is based on experience.

title: Video Editor – Health & Wellness Brands (US-Based Companies)
description:
Job Title: Video Editor – Health & Wellness Brands (US-Based Companies)

Employment Type: Full-Time (40 hrs/week preferred, 30 hrs minimum)

Rate: Negotiable based on experience

Schedule: Must have overlap with US Eastern Time (8am–12pm ET minimum)



About Us

We are a US-based franchise company operating three growing health and wellness brands:



ISI® Elite Training — a group fitness franchise with 60+ locations nationwide focused on high-intensity interval training and community-driven coaching | 



The Plunge House® — a premium cold plunge and wellness recovery brand expanding through franchising | 



Human Nutrition — a performance nutrition brand built for real people pursuing health and wellness goals I humannutrition.shop



We are building a world-class content operation to support brand growth, franchise development, and community engagement across all three brands. This is not a one-off freelance gig — we are building a long-term team and want someone who wants to grow with us.



The Role

We need a video editor who can handle everything from high-energy Reels and TikToks to polished talking head interviews, YouTube long-form, and motion graphics — and who understands that great editing is what separates content that gets scrolled past from content that stops people cold.



You will work directly with our content and marketing team to turn raw footage, B-roll, and creative briefs into finished assets that are on-brand, platform-optimized, and ready to publish. You will own the editing queue across three brands, manage your own workflow, and deliver without being chased.



This is a high-output, fast-paced role. We produce content consistently and need someone who can match that pace without sacrificing quality.



What You'll Own



Short-form video — Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts (15–90 seconds), optimized for each platform's native format and algorithm



Talking head content — clean, engaging edits of founder, coach, and expert interviews with captions, B-roll, and branded lower thirds



YouTube long-form — structured edits with intro hooks, chapter flow, B-roll integration, and retention-focused pacing



Motion graphics — animated titles, transitions, lower thirds, logo animations, and branded intro/outro sequences



Ad creative — performance-focused video ads for Meta, YouTube, and TikTok with strong hooks in the first 3 seconds



Podcast and interview clips — repurposing long-form content into short-form highlight clips across platforms



Story and vertical content — full-screen 9:16 edits for Instagram and TikTok Stories



Branded templates — building reusable editing templates for recurring content formats across all three brands



Caption and subtitle integration — accurate, styled captions for all short and long-form content



Sound design — music selection, audio cleanup, and sound effects that enhance the final product without overpowering it



Thumbnail coordination — working with our graphic designer to align video and thumbnail creative





What We're Looking For



* 3+ years of professional video editing experience

* Strong portfolio — fitness, wellness, lifestyle, nutrition, or consumer brands strongly preferred

* Expert-level proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects — this is non-negotiable

* Proficiency in DaVinci Resolve, Final Cut Pro, or CapCut is a plus

* Deep understanding of short-form content — what makes a hook work, how to hold attention, how to edit for platform behavior

* Motion graphics capability — you can animate, not just cut

* Strong audio instincts — music selection, pacing, and audio cleanup

* Understanding of aspect ratio optimization across platforms (9:16, 1:1, 16:9)

* Experience with caption styling and subtitle tools (Descript, Captions, or manual)

* Able to take a rough brief or raw footage and deliver a finished, publish-ready asset

* Organized file management — you label, sort, and store assets in a way that makes sense to everyone

* Comfortable joining video calls via Zoom or Google Meet for creative reviews and briefings

* Excellent English comprehension — written and spoken

* Self-managed, deadline-driven, and proactive about communicating timeline or feedback issues





Process & Queue Management

We run a fast content calendar across three brands. We need someone with a real workflow system — not someone who works reactively. As part of your application, tell us:



How do you manage an active editing queue when multiple projects are running simultaneously?



What tools do you use to track projects, versions, and feedback? (
, Notion, Trello, Asana, etc.)



How do you handle unclear briefs or missing assets — do you wait or do you problem-solve?



What does your typical turnaround look like for a 60-second Reel vs. a 10-minute YouTube video?



How do you stay current on platform trends and what's performing in short-form content?



There is no right answer — we want to see that you think like a professional, not a freelancer.



Commitment Requirement

This is a primary role, not a side project. Before applying, confirm the following:



1. This will be your main professional commitment and top priority

2. You are not at capacity with other clients that would compete for your time and attention

3. You are available during agreed-upon hours and can join video calls with reasonable notice

4. You can commit to consistent output and turnaround times week over week



If you cannot confirm the above, please do not apply.



What This Is Not

This is not a passive role where you wait for files to land in your inbox. We expect you to track the queue, flag issues early, ask smart questions, and deliver finished work that is ready to publish — not almost ready. If you need constant creative direction or can't manage your own time, this is not the right fit.



What You'll Get



1. Long-term engagement with a growing multi-brand company

2. Consistent, high-volume work across three distinct and visually interesting brands

3. Direct access to brand leadership — no layers of bureaucracy

4. Room to grow as our content operation scales

A5.  team that moves fast, values quality, and rewards ownership





How to Apply

Send the following — incomplete applications will not be reviewed:



1. Portfolio / Reel link (required — must include short-form content examples)

2. 3–5 examples of health, fitness, wellness, or lifestyle video work specifically

3. Examples of motion graphics — animated titles, lower thirds, or full motion sequences

4. At least one talking head edit showing your ability to pace, cut, and enhance interview-style content

5. At least one short-form example (Reel, TikTok, or Short) that you are proud of and why

6. Your workflow description — how you manage your queue, what tools you use, and how you handle a heavy week (5–7 sentences)

7. Confirmation that this role will be your primary professional commitment

8. Your availability and hours of overlap with US Eastern Time

9. Your rate expectation (hourly or monthly)

10. Confirmation that you are comfortable on video calls

title: Social Media Poster (TikTok / Instagram / YouTube) — Cloud Phone Posting
description:
Job Title  

Social Media Poster (TikTok / Instagram / YouTube) — Cloud Phone Posting  



Job Description  

We’re hiring a reliable, detail-oriented Social Media Poster to help run multiple short-form social accounts (TikTok, Instagram, YouTube) using cloud phones. This is a consistency + execution role: you follow a repeatable routine across many accounts and keep everything organized and logged.  



We’re a friendly, supportive working environment. We’ll train you, and we’re excited for you to gain real skills in social media operations and high-volume posting systems while working with us.  



What you’ll do (high level)  

- Find the next content to post using Google Sheets  

- Connect to assigned cloud phones (DuoPlus)  

- Scroll, comment, and post on TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube  

- Update the tracker spreadsheet as you go (Done / Issue + quick notes)  

- Move completed files in Google Drive so nothing gets reused incorrectly  



Schedule & availability  

- 40–50 hours/week  

- Two daily posting blocks (AM + PM) with flexibility in between — expect an 8–10 hour workday  

- Ideally 5 days/week on a consistent schedule  

- If you’re open to weekend work, we are looking for weekend shifts as well  



Communication  

- Must be comfortable coordinating in
  

- Available for occasional Google Meet calls for training and coordination  



Pay  

- $500/month base  

- +$100/month consistency bonus (for dependable attendance + completing assigned posting blocks with minimal issues)  

- Paid in USDT or USDC  



Requirements  

- Comfortable using TikTok/IG/YT interfaces and posting from drafts  

- Strong attention to detail (right account, right content, correct logging, no reuse mistakes)  

- Solid written English for comments (sounds human, not spammy)  

- Organized, dependable, and able to work steadily through repetitive tasks  



How to apply  

Send us a message. Please include:  

- A short summary of your experience posting to TikTok/Instagram/YouTube  

- Links to any accounts/pages you’ve posted for (or examples of similar work)  

- Which five days of the week you want to work (and whether you’re open to weekends)  

- Comment test: Open this video 
 and write a draft reply to the 3 comments from Sam, Maya Amick, and Liss. Each reply should (1) respond authentically to the comment you’re replying to, (2) sound like a real user, and (3) explain that you’ve been able to connect with God by using the Call Jesus app. You don’t need to post these comments — just include them in your application message to us.

title: Kajabi Specialist - Tiered Membership Architecture & "Plug and Play" Shell
description:
Project Overview:

I am an executive coach launching a membership program with a tiered access model. I need a Kajabi Expert to build a "shell" that supports four distinct price points, with content automatically "locked" or "unlocked" based on the member’s tier.



Scope of Work (Technical Framework):



Four-Tier Offer Setup: Configure Kajabi Offers for 1) Personal Growth, 2) Coaching Level, 3) Business Building, and 4) All-Access Mentorship.



Product Permissions: Build a single Product/Library where categories are restricted by the specific Offer purchased. Members in lower tiers should see locked content as an incentive to upgrade.



Drip Content Shell: Set up a monthly "Drip" framework for:



The Monthly Tool: A template page for the new tool released each month.



Live Mentorship Archive: A categorized video library for monthly call recordings. An area to go live from. 



Founding Member Kit: Create a dedicated "Start Here" module with placeholders for a "North Star" video, a "First Win" tool, and a 90-day roadmap.



Branding & Legal: Ensure the registered trademark and 2026 copyright are in all footers.

 list access

Full use of Kajabi features

You will be starting from scratch; all I have is the domain name. I would appreciate it if you can do the logo as well, I have something in mind.



Requirements:



Advanced knowledge of Kajabi Offers vs. Products and permission settings.



Experience setting up Drip Categories to release content on a schedule.



Ability to create a "Premium/Executive" visual style that matches my brand authority.



Willingness to record a short walkthrough video (Loom) explaining the backend setup for me.



To Apply: Please use the word "DOORS" in your subject line. Briefly explain how you have handled tiered permissions in Kajabi before.

title: Virtual Assistant/Job Application Specialist for US-Based Professional
description:
I'm a software engineer looking for a part-time VA to help with my job application process. You'll source relevant mid-to-senior SWE roles at big tech companies, submit applications on my behalf, and track everything in a shared spreadsheet. I anticipate this to be an initial 4-6 week engagement with the potential to extend.



Your daily responsibilities would include:

- Source 15-25 relevant mid/senior software engineer roles per week from job boards (LinkedIn, Lever, Greenhouse, company career pages, Hiring Cafe, etc.)

- Log each opportunity in our shared Google Sheet with: company name, role title, job URL, date posted, key requirements, and application status

- Submit applications through company portals and job boards



Required technical skills and experience:



- Familiarity with tech industry job boards: LinkedIn, Greenhouse, Lever, Workday, company career pages

- Basic understanding of software engineering terminology - you need to know the difference between "frontend," "backend," "full-stack," "distributed systems," "Python," "Java," etc.



Soft skills:

- Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision. 

- Strong attention to detail

- Proactive communicator. 



Basic skills:

- Google Sheets, Gmail, web research and navigation of job application portals, basic PDF/file handling.



Nice to have:

- Experience specifically placing candidates at FAANG / big tech companies. Familiarity with ATS systems.



Work schedule:

- Part-time, 5-10 hours per week, flexible schedule. No fixed hours required. I'm in US Central Time (Austin, TX).



Salary:

$4/hour USD, paid weekly



Bonuses:

- $25 USD bonus for every interview I receive as a direct result of your application. $100 USD bonus if I receive an offer from a role you applied to.



Duration:

Initial 4-6 week trial. If we're getting good results, I'll extend.



How to apply:

- Subject line: "SWE Job App Specialist - [Your Name]"

- Please complete this Google Form: 

- Trial Task (complete within 48 hours of submitting the form):



- Find 5 relevant mid/senior software engineer roles at big tech companies (Google, Meta, Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, Netflix, or similar tier)

- Add them to this Google Sheet: 

- For each role, note: Company, Role Title, Job URL, Location/Remote, Key Requirements (3-5 bullet points), and why it's a good fit



Only candidates who complete both the form and the trial task will be considered.

title: Logo Designer - Premium Executive Brand (RESETABILITY®)
description:
Job Title: Logo Designer - Premium Executive Brand (RESETABILITY®)

Project Overview:

I am seeking a Graphic Designer to create a high-end logo for Resetability, a membership program for leaders and professional coaches. The brand represents a "reset" in perspective and leadership mastery.



Design Concepts to Explore:

I have two specific creative directions I would like to see developed:



Typography & Motion: A clean wordmark for RESETABILITY® where half of the word is italicized. This should create a sense of movement, transition, or a "shift" in perspective without losing professional authority.



Minimalist Iconography: Incorporating a subtle stopwatch or timer graphic. This should be a minimalist, modern icon (not a literal illustration) that represents the concept of a "reset" or "time for change."



Combination: A version that elegantly combines the italicized typography with a small, sophisticated stopwatch element.



Design Requirements:



Premium Aesthetic: The final result must feel like an established executive brand (think clean, bold, and modern).



Trademark Integration: The design must cleanly include the ® symbol as it is a registered mark in Canada.



Colors: I am looking for an "Executive Authority" palette (e.g., Deep Navy and Silver, or Charcoal and Teal).



Deliverables: High-resolution Vector files (AI, SVG), PNG (transparent), and a Favicon for my Kajabi site.



To Apply: Please use the word "STOPWATCH" in your subject line and provide 2-3 samples of logos where you have used typography to show movement or "shifts."

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Position: Recruitment Consultant (Domestic Assistance – Aged Care)

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Reports to: Team Lead

Hours: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 9:00am–5:00pm (AEST)





- Why This Role Matters -



At Maid My Day, the quality of care we deliver starts with who we bring into the business.



Our Home Support Workers support older Australians to live safely and independently in their homes. The Recruitment Consultant plays a critical role in ensuring we select people who are not only capable - but aligned with our standards, values, and long-term vision.



This is not just a sourcing role.

It’s a standards-setting role.



If you believe that hiring the right person changes everything, enjoy structured processes, and take pride in building strong foundations for teams - keep reading.





- About Maid My Day -



Maid My Day is a trusted provider of Domestic Assistance services within the Australian Aged Care sector, operating across Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra, and South Australia.



With over 20 years of experience and a growing workforce of 200+ Home Support Workers, our mission is simple:

Deliver consistent, high-quality care for older Australians

Create meaningful, stable employment pathways for our workers

Build partnerships that last



We currently have 24 full-time Virtual Assistants based in the Philippines, working remotely in a collaborative and accountable environment.





- About the Role -



As the Recruitment Consultant, you are responsible for what happens before onboarding.



Your focus is to:

Attract the right candidates -- not just available candidates

Screen thoroughly and assess for long-term fit

Ensure every successful hire is prepared, compliant, and aligned before they start

Maintain structure, reporting, and recruitment timelines through HubSpot

Build partnerships that strengthen our recruitment pipeline



You will utilise HubSpot as your primary recruitment tracking and pipeline management system -- ensuring every candidate is properly logged, progressed, followed up, and reported on accurately.



You’ll work closely with:

The Scheduling Team and internal Team

Home Support Worker Managers

External employment agencies and partners

This role requires strong judgment, attention to detail, and the confidence to say “no” when standards aren’t met.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



Coordinating with Scheduling and Home Support Worker Managers to understand workforce needs

Screening applicants and conducting structured interviews

Managing the recruitment pipeline within HubSpot (status updates, follow-ups, reporting)

Maintaining accurate recruitment calendars and performance reports

Conducting reference checks and verifying documentation

Inducting successful candidates and preparing them for onboarding

Administering and coordinating Licence to Clean training requirements

Providing consistent follow-up and communication throughout the recruitment process

Supporting continuous improvement of recruitment systems and workflows within HubSpot





- What We’re Looking For -



You’ll thrive in this role if you:

Have at least 2+ years’ experience in recruitment, talent acquisition, or a similar role

Have experience using CRM (HubSpot experience highly preferred)

Understand structured recruitment processes and screening techniques

Communicate clearly, confidently, and professionally

Are highly organised and comfortable managing multiple vacancies at once

Are proactive and able to work independently in a remote setup

Take accountability for KPIs and recruitment outcomes

Have a positive, solutions-focused mindset

Highly regarded experience:

title: Book Cover Designer
description:
PLEASE ONLY APPLY:



If you have designed Book Covers before.



And can verify, that the designs are made by you and are 100% Copyright Free.



Website: buch-glueck. .de also cont. info there



We run an online shop specialising in journals and guided books for couples and individuals. We are currently developing a 3-book couple journal series and are looking for a talented designer to create the front cover designs for the full series.

About the first book:

The title of the first book is Schatz, wir erzählen unsere Geschichte (German: "Darling, we tell our story"). It is a guided couple journal that takes partners through their shared history — from how they met, early memories and milestones, to challenges overcome together and dreams for the future. The book is designed as a premium gift item for occasions like anniversaries, weddings and Valentine's Day.

What we are looking for:

We want a clean, elegant aesthetic — minimal but warm, with a sense of romance and timelessness. Strong typography is key. We love the idea of beautiful, thematic illustrations or decorative elements that feel intentional and refined, rather than ornate or busy. Think less is more — but what is there should be truly beautiful.

For the series as a whole, we want all three covers to feel cohesive when placed side by side: a unified colour palette, consistent typographic style and a visual language that ties them together as a collection.

Series scope:

We are requesting a concept for Book 1 to start, along with a quote for designing all three covers as a package. The format is B5+, front cover only for now (spine and back to follow later). The books will be printed on premium coated paper with full-colour print and the option for gold foil stamping

Our style:

Clean. Elegant. Gift-worthy. A "fit for all" aesthetic that feels premium without being cold — romantic without being cliché.

We would love to hear your ideas. Please send us your concept proposal and package pricing for all three covers including revision rounds and final file formats.

- Identify top-performing competitors by ad volume and creative output

- Flag winning ad patterns, hooks, and product positioning

? Must have:

? Nice to have:

title: Video Ad Editor (Direct Response) for Evervive + other stores
description:
We’re looking for a Video Editor and Graphic Designer to help us produce direct response video ads and simple design assets for our e-commerce brands. The main skill we care about is your ability to take reference ads, recreate the style, then make variations so we can test more angles.



We are Evervive, a home goods brand focused on home care and restoration. We also operate multiple online stores and plan to scale creative output across more brands over time, so this can become long-term ongoing work with increasing volume if it’s a good fit.



This is part-time to start at 10 to 15 hours per week. Pay is $10 to $15 per hour depending on speed and quality. Hours can increase over time as we expand work across our stores.



You will edit short-form ads for paid social, mainly 9:16, sometimes 1:1 and 4:5. You should be able to match competitor or reference ads in pacing, captions, and structure while keeping everything Evervive-branded. You will create variations from a base edit with new hooks, new first 3 seconds, and different CTAs. You will also make simple graphics when needed like end cards, badges, frames, and product callouts. We want you to use AI tools where helpful and keep improving your AI workflow over time so our production stays modern.



We need someone with a portfolio showing direct response or social ad edits that are similar in style. You can use any solid editing software you prefer. Clear communication and consistent delivery matter. AI experience is required and willingness to keep learning is required.



For the interview, we’ll start with a very small test edit, about a 10-minute task, so we can see your style match and workflow. We’ll provide a reference ad style and a Drive folder with assets. You will deliver 1 UGC style edit for our product, Evervive Leather & Wood Restoring Salve.



Disclaimer: This test is only to showcase your abilities. We are not using your work commercially unless we agree to move forward and hire you.



Inspiration sources

Evervive Ad Library: 



Competitor 1: 



Competitor 2: 



Available content

Our Content folder: 



Submission guidelines

Submit your video as a high-resolution MP4 or MOV file directly in messages as an attachment.



How to apply

Send your application through the platform with links to 2 to 3 ads you have edited that match this style, tell us what editing software you use, tell us which AI tools you use, and tell us your hourly rate and weekly availability.

title: Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) Transcript Editor – Long-Term Collaboration
description:
I am a Traditional Chinese Medicine student in a multi-year professional program. I have lecture recordings with AI-generated transcripts that contain terminology errors, particularly in Chinese medical vocabulary.



I am looking for someone who would like to work alongside me long-term — ideally for the next few years — helping ensure my transcripts are accurate, clear, and professionally edited.



This is not basic transcription work. The transcripts already exist. I need someone to:



• Listen carefully to full lecture recordings

• Follow along with the transcript and correct inaccuracies

• Fix spelling and formatting of medical and TCM terminology

• Correct pinyin transliterations when needed (e.g., Gu Qi, Wei Qi, Zang-Fu, etc.)

• Maintain clean, consistent formatting

• Gradually build familiarity with recurring terminology and concepts



Understanding of Traditional Chinese Medicine terminology is strongly preferred.

Familiarity with pinyin and Chinese medical theory is a strong advantage.



I value consistency and relationship-building. My goal is to work with the same person steadily over the coming years as I move through my TCM education. Over time, you would become increasingly familiar with the terminology and teaching style, making the workflow more efficient for both of us.



There will be ongoing weekly work (multiple lectures per week)



To Apply, Please Send:



• Your hourly rate

• Your experience editing transcripts (medical or academic preferred)

• Any experience with TCM or Chinese terminology

• A short introduction about why long-term collaboration interests you

• I will provide a short test clip for a sample edit

title: Highticket DM Setter
description:
Now Hiring: Instagram DM Setter | High-Ticket Women’s Wellness Program



We are hiring a confident, emotionally intelligent Instagram DM Setter to help guide women who are serious about losing weight, balancing their hormones, and transforming their health.



This role is not about cold outreach or pressure sales. These are inbound leads — women engaging with our content, taking quizzes, watching trainings, and replying to stories because they are already looking for help.



Your job is to connect with them, ask the right questions, build trust, qualify them properly, and guide the right candidates onto a high-ticket strategy call for our Best of You transformation programs.



You will be speaking to women 35+ who are:

• Struggling with weight gain, especially around menopause

• Dealing with bloating, fatigue, inflammation, or hormonal imbalance

• Frustrated because what used to work no longer works

• Tired of dieting and ready for real structure

• Willing to invest in their health if they believe it will work



This is a high integrity sales role. You are not convincing people to buy something they don’t need. You are helping women decide if they are truly ready to commit to transformation.



Your Responsibilities:

• Respond to inbound Instagram DMs daily

• Engage story replies and quiz responders

• Ask structured qualifying questions

• Identify serious, coachable prospects

• Handle common objections professionally

• Book qualified leads onto high-ticket strategy calls

• Track conversations and follow-ups consistently

• Communicate daily with the team



You Are:

• Confident and comfortable discussing weight loss and hormones

• Skilled at leading conversations without being pushy

• Able to build rapport quickly

• Organized and detail oriented

• Comfortable asking about budget and readiness

• Experienced in sales or appointment setting (preferred)

• Emotionally mature and professional



You Understand:

This is not a “discount offer.”

We work with women who are ready to invest in themselves.

You must be comfortable qualifying out people who are not a fit.



This is a remote position with daily availability required. Consistency is non-negotiable.



If you understand women’s weight loss struggles, believe in transformation, and know how to guide someone from interest to commitment, we want to hear from you.

title: Operations & Systems Coordinator
description:

Our client is seeking an Operations & Systems Coordinator to support a growing luxury short-term rental (STR) portfolio in Austin, Texas. We are looking for an “orchestrator”, someone who thrives on building order from chaos, documenting workflows, and helping a founder step out of day-to-day operations. 



You won’t just execute tasks; you will design and improve the infrastructure that makes this business scalable. This role is ideal for a proactive professional who wants to grow into an operational leadership position. 



What You’ll Own 



Systems & SOP Development (Primary Focus) 



Process Documentation: Turn task notes into clean, usable SOPs and checklists for guest experience and property ops. 

Optimization: Identify inefficiencies and proactively recommend workflow improvements. 

Tracking: Build and maintain simple systems (vendor trackers, maintenance logs, escalation dashboards). 

AI Integration: Support the implementation of AI-assisted workflows and operational automation. 



Vendor Coordination & Property Operations 



Scheduling: Coordinate cleaners, maintenance, and specialty vendors (pool, landscaping, etc.). 

Communication: Use text/email for efficiency; make phone calls to US vendors when speed is required. 

Quality Control: Maintain vendor notes, pricing, and performance tracking. 

Triage: Handle maintenance troubleshooting and ensure timely resolutions. 



Guest Operations & Tech Management 



System Oversight: Manage AI messaging tools (Hospitable, HostBuddy) to ensure concierge-level service. 

Escalations: Professionally handle high-risk guest situations and flag risks before they affect reviews. 

Knowledge Base: Maintain property FAQs and internal reference guides. 



Admin & Financial Support 



Daily Reporting: Send structured daily summaries highlighting progress and bottlenecks. 

Finance: Support basic workflows, including vendor payments and expense tracking in QuickBooks. 

Growth: Assist with CRM hygiene (GoHighLevel/Vintory) and market research. 



Who This Role Is For 



You may be a strong fit if you:  



Have STR Experience: You understand the fast-paced nature of property management. 

Are a Systems Thinker: You have built or improved SOPs and workflows before. 

Communicate Confidently: Exceptional spoken and written English; comfortable calling US vendors. 

Are Proactive: You think three steps ahead rather than waiting for instructions. 

Are AI-Fluency: You use AI tools beyond basic prompts to summarize data and draft systems. 

Have High Discernment: You know when a process doesn't make sense and needs to be updated. 



Preferred Qualifications 



Hands-on experience with Hospitable (Highly Preferred). 

Experience managing or scaling a portfolio of multiple properties. 

Familiarity with QuickBooks, CRM platforms, or OpenPhone. 

Spanish fluency is a plus (for vendor coordination). 



What Success Looks Like Within 90 days: 



Vendor coordination runs smoothly with minimal founder involvement. 

A centralized "SOP Library" is documented and being utilized. 

Operational tasks are tracked in a clear, transparent dashboard. 

The founder is focused on growth and partnerships, confident that the "machine" is running. 



Compensation & Schedule 



Hourly Rate: $7-12/hr (based on experience) 

Schedule: Wednesday- Monday, aligned with peak guest stays and opportunity to increase hours as the business scales 

Full-Time: 30-40 hrs/week

title: Construction Accounting
description:
We’re hiring a Project Accountant to support construction, loan, and compliance operations across multiple affordable housing developments. If you’re detail-driven, good with documentation, and like work that has real impact, this is a strong long-term fit.



Why You’ll Love This Role



You will work directly with decision-makers — your work will be visible and valued.

You will help keep projects compliant, funded, and on schedule.

No bureaucracy, no busywork — your work directly moves projects forward.

Real room to grow into senior financial coordination or project support.



Your Typical Day

Organize and maintain project financial and compliance documentation.

Support the preparation of monthly construction draw requests.

Communicate with contractors to collect invoices, lien waivers, and documents.

Update budgets, change order logs, and payment tracking sheets.

Coordinate with lenders, accounting, and project managers as needed.



What You’ll Be Doing



1) Loan & Draw Support

Compile lien waivers, invoices, schedules, and supporting docs for draw packages.

Compare cost reports to contracts, change orders, and lender requirements.

Track soft costs (architect, engineering, inspections, interest, title, etc.).

Prepare clear, organized submission files for lenders.



2) Construction Financial Administration

Maintain digital project files (contracts, pay apps, insurance, permits, payrolls).

Track executed change orders against pay apps and budgets.

Monitor buyout logs, completion schedules, and compliance documents.

Follow up with contractors until documentation is accurate and complete.



3) General Coordination & Reporting

Maintain trackers, logs, and internal reports.

Prepare agendas, notes, and status reports for project meetings.

Communicate professionally with internal and external stakeholders.

Handle confidential financial data with discretion.



What We’re Looking For

2–4+ years in project accounting, construction admin, or loan/draw processing.

Familiarity with construction draws, budgets, or lender compliance preferred.

Proficiency in Excel and document management tools (Procore/Built/Buildertrend a bonus).

Extremely organized, detail-accurate, and accountable to deadlines.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Experience working for a US construction company or real-estate developer



Nice to Have

Experience in real estate development or affordable housing.

Knowledge of construction accounting.

Experience with billing using AIA G702/G703 forms.

Degree in Accounting, Construction Mgmt, Business, or related field.



TO APPLY: send a recording via 
 and answer these questions:

1.) What struck your interest about the role?

2.) Tell me about your experience in construction accounting?



SUBJECT: Construction Accounting - YOUR NAME



About Us



Atrium Housing is a mission-driven affordable housing developer with an affiliated construction company with offices in Louisiana, Florida and Texas. We don’t just build buildings — we create opportunities for families and communities. Our finance and construction teams work with lenders, contractors, and public partners to move projects from concept to completion.

title: Part Time VA - Ads + Tracking + Speed to Lead Calls + Calendar
description:
About us: We build lead gen systems for Canadian home renovation contractors (kitchen, bath, basement). Meta ads + GoHighLevel funnels + tight follow?up. Fast, SOP driven, zero drama.



Role outcome: You keep ads delivering, tracking clean, new leads contacted within 1–3 minutes, and the calendar full of qualified appointments. Yesterday’s KPIs are in the sheet by 10 a.m. MST. 



What you’ll do: Own daily KPI hygiene: pull spend, CPM, CTR, CPC link, CPL, cost per booked, show rate, quotes?issued rate, CPQA; flag reds vs thresholds and note actions taken. Build and maintain Meta campaigns: correct naming, budgets, geo, placements, UTMs; load creatives from our library; rotate when thresholds are hit; keep frequency and fatigue in check. Manage tracking and lead flow: pixel + CAPI health checks, domain verify, event testing, dedup true; map FB lead forms to GHL, ensure tags, pipelines, and triggers fire. 



Speed to lead calls: call new leads within 1–3 minutes, use our script and 2–3 qualifiers, book into the right calendar, send confirmations, and log outcomes. 



Calendar hygiene: confirmations, reschedules, day of reminders, and same day outcome capture (quoted/not quoted + rough value) after appointments. Daily digest: best/worst ads, anomalies, fixes made, what’s queued for tomorrow, and any escalations for tech.



Must have experience: Meta Ads Manager end to end builds. CAPI + Pixel setup and Test Events troubleshooting; UTMs and naming conventions. GoHighLevel: pipelines, calendars, triggers, tags, webhooks/zaps. Outbound calling in English with clear, confident delivery; comfort following a script and logging notes fast. Google Sheets proficiency, Loom screen shares, and SOP discipline.



Nice to have: Basic video clipping (CapCut/Canva) for ad variants. Typeform/Calendly; light Zapier.



Schedule: Part time 20-25 hours. Daily KPI update due by 10 a.m. MST. Available to call new leads in real time during agreed coverage windows.



Compensation: $
a month to start depending on experience, plus performance bonus after 60 days for error free tracking, on time reporting, and speed to lead SLAs hit.



How to apply: Reply with "Launch and Land"



Send:

A 60-second Loom video introducing yourself - tell me your name, where you are based, and why this role is a fit for you. 



Second, one paragraph describing a real situation where you called a lead within 5 minutes and booked the appointment, be specific about what CRM you were using and what happened on the call.

Excited to hear from you!

title: Daily News Producer for Traditional Community Channel (Long-Term / Early Morning EST)
description:
Daily News Producer for Traditional Community Channel (Long-Term / Early Morning EST)



**Job Description:**

We run a rapidly growing daily news program (40k+ subscribers) serving a specific traditional community. We are looking for a reliable **Daily Production Assistant** for a long-term position to handle our pre-production workflow.



**The Goal:**

Hand off a fully prepped script and asset package so the host can simply sit down and record. You handle the prep, asset collection, and publishing.



**Schedule (Crucial):**

This is a split-shift role required Monday–Friday.



* **Prep Shift:** 4:00 AM – 7:00 AM EST (Story selection & Asset gathering)

* **Publishing Shift:** Approx. 10:00 AM – 11:00 AM EST (Uploading & Metadata)

* *Note: Publishing time may vary slightly depending on when the recording is finished.*



**Responsibilities:**



* **Story Curation:** Select daily breaking news items that fit our audience.

* **Asset Sourcing (Crucial):** Find high-quality images and video clips for the stories.

* **Post-Production:** Upload to video platforms, write descriptions, and manage thumbnails.



**Critical Requirements:**



* **Strict Image Guidelines:** You must adhere to strict traditional community standards. This includes **no images of females** and ensuring all visuals are modest and "clean."

* **Daily Consistency:** Missing a deadline is not an option. You must be awake and active during the 4 AM EST slot.

* **Unbiased Reporting:** Ability to filter news without political bias.



**To Apply:**



1. Confirm you are available for the specific split hours (5am–7am EST & 10am–11am EST).

2. Confirm you are comfortable working with strict visual guidelines (specifically the restriction on female imagery).

title: Inhouse Meta Media Buyer / Facebook Ads Specialist (Legazpi Office)
description:
High-Ticket Lead Gen | Home Improvement & Trade Services | Full-Time, Onsite



Location: Legazpi City; The Backspace Co-working Space

Schedule: Monday–Friday 8AM–5PM | Saturday 8AM–12NN

Open to: Experienced Meta media buyers willing to relocate to the Legazpi area



About Us

We are an Australian-based startup agency working with high-ticket home improvement, HVAC, solar, and construction companies. We already have a growing team in Legazpi City and are now looking for a dedicated Meta Media Buyer to join us onsite.



Our permanent office is currently under construction and will be ready within the next couple of months. In the meantime, we've secured a co-working space at The Backspace exclusively for this role.



Why Onsite?



We've learned the hard way that media buying for high-ticket services requires real-time collaboration, fast creative feedback loops, same-room strategy sessions, and instant alignment when campaigns need pivoting. 



As a startup, speed is everything. Having our media buyer in the same room as the rest of the team eliminates the lag that kills campaign performance. 



You'll be working closely with leadership and operations daily, and the best ideas and fastest optimizations happen face to face, not in Slack threads. This is a core team role, not a freelance task.



Your Role



You will own Meta ad campaigns end-to-end, from strategy and launch to optimization and reporting, for clients in competitive, high-ticket service industries.



Core responsibilities:



Launch, manage, and scale Meta 
 & Instagram) ad campaigns

Optimize for Cost Per Lead, booking rates, and ROAS

Build and test high-ticket lead generation funnels

Develop retargeting and nurture audiences

Report on pipeline value, CAC, and revenue attribution

Collaborate directly with leadership and the Legazpi team



Where this role is headed:



This won't stay a Meta-only position. We will provide hands-on training in Google Ads and AI-powered content creation to grow you into a full-stack digital marketer.



What We Provide



Laptop and all necessary equipment - you just show up ready to work

Dedicated workspace at The Backspace (and our permanent office once completed)

Structured training in Google Ads and AI content creation

Direct mentorship from leadership



What We're Looking For



Proven experience running Meta ad campaigns with real, measurable results

Comfortable managing meaningful ad budgets for lead generation

Thinks in systems and data, not vanity metrics

Highly organized, self-driven, and accountable

Willing to learn new platforms and tools quickly



Bonus if you have (but not required):



Experience in home services, construction, solar, or trade industries

Google Ads experience

Familiarity with AI tools for content or automation



Compensation



First 3 months (probation): PHP 70,000/month

Post-probation: Up to PHP 125,000/month

Performance bonuses tied to client results and growth



Who This Is NOT For



Social media managers who only post content

Media buyers who can't show real campaign results

People who need constant hand-holding



Who This IS For



Media buyers who obsess over metrics and optimization

Operators who want to grow into a bigger role fast

People excited to be part of a startup team building something real



How to Apply

Send us:



1.  A short summary of why you're a great fit

2.  Examples or screenshots of past Meta campaign results

3.  A brief Loom video introducing yourself



We're looking for someone who can execute, optimize, and scale, not just manage.
